analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i gzugs dang ldan pa /

original: zhags pa 'dzin pa /

analyzed: g-yon pa 'od dpag can phyag na padma bsnams pa /

analyzed: phyag g-yas pa mdung rtse gsum pa dang / @177a *//

original: dbugs 'byin cing rtag tu mchog sbyin par mdzad pa /
analyzed: dbugs 'byin cing rtag tu mchog sbyin par mdzad pa /

original: mgon po shin tu mdzes pa /
analyzed: mgon po shin tu mdzes pa /

analyzed: nor bu dang / mu tig gi rgyan gyi mtshams su gser gyi rgyan gyis g-yogs pa'i cod pan nam /

analyzed: yang na spyi gtsug tu ring bsrel bzhag par byas la /

original: tsandan dkar po'i dkyil 'khor bya zhing gur gum dang / gla rtsi dang / ga bur gyis mchod la dkyil 'khor gyi snying po 'di'i dbus su padma ge sar dang bcas pa'i 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis pa bris la de'i dbus su 'jigs pa med pas 'jig rten dbang phyug dar gyi con pan gyis bcings pa bzhag la; aa ga ru
analyzed: tsandan dkar po'i dkyil 'khor bya zhing gur gum dang / gla rtsi dang / ga bur gyis mchod la dkyil 'khor gyi snying po 'di'i dbus su padma ge sar dang bcas pa'i 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis pa bris la de'i dbus su 'jigs pa med pas 'jig rten dbang phyug dar gyi con pan gyis bcings pa bzhag la; aa ga ru
translated: Make a maṇḍala of white sandalwood, and worship with saffron, musk, and camphor. In the center of the maṇḍala, draw a lotus with stamens and thirty-two petals. In the center of that, place Avalokiteśvara, the Lord of the World, bound with a silk ribbon, with no fear.

original: dang / tsandan gyi bdug pa dbul zhing me tog dgram par bya /
analyzed: dang / tsandan gyi bdug pa dbul zhing me tog dgram par bya /

analyzed: me tog gi phreng bas mchod par bya'o //
translated: Worship with flower garlands.

original: rig sngags 'chang gtsang mar gyur pa shin tu khrus byas pa gos gtsang ma bgos pas smyung ba byas la mgon po 'jig rten dbang phyug mngon du phyogs par skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug la mchod yon dang / lha bshos phul la byams pa'i sems la mnyam par bzhag ste sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang gtsang mar gyur pa shin tu khrus byas pa gos gtsang ma bgos pas smyung ba byas la mgon po 'jig rten dbang phyug mngon du phyogs par skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug la mchod yon dang / lha bshos phul la byams pa'i sems la mnyam par bzhag ste sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom mo //
translated: The vidyādhara, having become pure, having bathed well, having put on clean clothes, having fasted, having sat down cross-legged facing the Lord Avalokiteśvara, having offered water for the mouth and a bali, having settled in a loving mind, should cultivate the recollection of the Buddha.

original: sems can thams cad la brtse bar gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin yang bsgom zhing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la brtse bar gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin yang bsgom zhing /

analyzed: @177b gtam gzhan mi smra bar shin tu yongs su sbyar ba legs par spyod cing /

analyzed: gzhan 'jigs pa med pas bdag srung ba dang / phyogs bcing ba dang / dkyil 'khor bcing ba bsrung ba dang bcas pa yang byas la bzlas brjod de nyid stong rtsa brgyad dang / phyag rgya yang stong rtsa brgyad brtsams na /

analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi mchog sbyin par mdzad pa'i phyag spyi bor bzhag ste legs so legs so //

analyzed: rig sngags 'chang khyod kyis mchod pa dam pa dang / gsang sngags kyi cho ga chen po byas so //

original: sgrub pa dam pa byas so //
analyzed: sgrub pa dam pa byas so //

translated: This is the general family of the Tathāgata, and the secret detailed rite of all the Tathāgata families, the rite of the seal and the maṇḍala, and the attainment of all the general accomplishments will be accomplished for you, O vidyādhara.

translated: Uphold the essence of Amoghapāśa, and whatever the vidyādhara wishes for, whatever the supreme wish, whatever is mentally conceived, all that will be granted.

analyzed: 'di ni / khyod kyi skye ba'i 'khor ba tha ma yin te /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa tshe dpag med mngon sum du mthong bar 'gyur /

original: cod pa na la mngon par gtor na /
analyzed: cod pa na la mngon par gtor na /
translated: Then the vidyādhara should scatter flowers or a diadem over the wrathful king.

analyzed: des na 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rang gi skur bzhugs te /

analyzed: sku gzugs sgrub pa de kho na nyid ces pa 'di gal te rig sngags 'chang skal pa chung ba mnar med par gzhol ba /
translated: “If the vidyādhara of little fortune, who is heading for Avīci,

analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga byed pa de lan gcig nges par sgrub pa tsam gyis mdun du rang gi gzugs kyis nges par mchis par bgyi'o //

translated: “If someone who has generated the intention to draw blood from all tathāgatas and the buddhas of the three times out of hatred were to accomplish the vidyādhara, then, blessed by the great pledge of the intention of all tathāgatas and the buddhas of the three times, I would grant him the sight of my form in a dream.

analyzed: yid la bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bgyi'o //

analyzed: sdig pa dang sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag par bgyi'o //

analyzed: sad nas 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi mchod pa'i 'os chen po gcig pur 'gyur ro //

analyzed: sgo kun tu dri ma med par snang ba zhes bya ba'i lus yongs su dag pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: sems can gang dag gis de mthong bar gyur pa de dag thams cad sgrib pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: nad thams cad dang bral zhing nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: par bgyi / rang gi gzugs kyis mthong ba stsal bar bgyi na /

translated: what need is there to mention a faithful human being who is diligent in the practice of vows? I will appear before him in my own form merely by his remembering me,

original: yid la bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bgyi ste /
analyzed: yid la bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bgyi ste /
translated: and I will fulfill all his wishes.

original: 'di la the tshom dang / yid gnyis bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la the tshom dang / yid gnyis bskyed par mi bya'o //

original: de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi /
translated: However,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: yid gnyis su mi byed pa; ngo gnyis can /

analyzed: byas pa mi gzo ba /

analyzed: bdag la yang ma gus par bgyed pa /

analyzed: rab tu zhi ba'i rnam par shin tu mdzes par bya'o //
translated: the one with the most beautiful form of complete peace.

original: gsang sngags brgyad stong bzlas brjod byas pas lan gcig sgrub pa ni /
analyzed: gsang sngags brgyad stong bzlas brjod byas pas lan gcig sgrub pa ni /
translated: Reciting the eight thousand mantras is the single accomplishment,

original: mchog yin te /
analyzed: mchog yin te /
translated: which is supreme.

original: 'di yongs su rdzogs nas khro bo'i rgyal pos thams cad la mngon du gtor te /
analyzed: 'di yongs su rdzogs nas khro bo'i rgyal pos thams cad la mngon du gtor te /
translated: After completing this, the King of Wrathful Ones should be invoked to all,

original: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis las brtsam mo //
analyzed: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis las brtsam mo //
translated: and then the knowledge-mantra holder should begin the rite.

original: de nas rig sngags 'chang gtsang mar gyur pas gos gtsang ma bgos te shin tu khrus byas la dris byugs pas dkyil 'khor gru bzhi shin tu mdzes pa /
analyzed: de nas rig sngags 'chang gtsang mar gyur pas gos gtsang ma bgos te shin tu khrus byas la dris byugs pas dkyil 'khor gru bzhi shin tu mdzes pa /
translated: Then, the pure knowledge-mantra holder, having put on clean clothes, should bathe well and anoint the ground. The maṇḍala should be square, very beautiful,

original: gsal ba ko la'i tshad tsam gyi dkyil 'khor bzang po legs par byugs pa shin tu gsal ba bya'o //
analyzed: gsal ba ko la'i tshad tsam gyi dkyil 'khor bzang po legs par byugs pa shin tu gsal ba bya'o //
translated: and well-smeared, with a good maṇḍala the size of a kosa, very clear.

original: dri sna tshogs kyis byugs pa shin tu 'jam pa la tsandan dkar po dang / gur gum gyis dbus su las kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par phye ba bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dri sna tshogs kyis byugs pa shin tu 'jam pa la tsandan dkar po dang / gur gum gyis dbus su las kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par phye ba bri bar bya'o //
translated: It should be anointed with various fragrances, very smooth, and in the center, the maṇḍala of activity should be drawn with white sandalwood and saffron.

original: 'dir padma yang byas te /
analyzed: 'dir padma yang byas te /
translated: Here, the lotus should also be made,

original: 'dab ma brgya rtsa brgyad pa ge sar dang snying por bcas pa /
analyzed: 'dab ma brgya rtsa brgyad pa ge sar dang snying por bcas pa /
translated: with 108 petals, with stamens and a pericarp,

original: shin tu mdzes pa /
analyzed: shin tu mdzes pa /
translated: very beautiful,

original: shin tu bzang ba /
analyzed: shin tu bzang ba /
translated: very good,

original: tsandan dang gur gum gyis bri bar bya ste /🔽der tshon rtsi gzhan ni /
analyzed: tsandan dang gur gum gyis bri bar bya ste / der tshon rtsi gzhan ni /
translated: drawn with sandalwood and saffron.

original: spyad par mi bya'o //🔽bum pa spos chus bkang ba dang / de bzhin du dri chu dang / gtor ma thams cad dri sna tshogs @183a *//
analyzed: spyad par mi bya'o // bum pa spos chus bkang ba dang / de bzhin du dri chu dang / gtor ma thams cad dri sna tshogs @183a *//
translated: Here, one should not use other paints.

original: kyis bsgos pa dang / ci yod pa'i gtor ma bzhag ste /
analyzed: kyis bsgos pa dang / ci yod pa'i gtor ma bzhag ste /
translated: One should fill the vases with perfumed water, and likewise with scented water, and all the bali offerings should be anointed with various fragrances, and whatever bali offerings there are should be arranged.

original: de nas 'dir dkyil 'khor bya ba'i gnas sam /
analyzed: de nas 'dir dkyil 'khor bya ba'i gnas sam /
translated: Then, in this place where the maṇḍala is to be made,

original: dgon pa'am / khyim mam /
analyzed: dgon pa'am / khyim mam /
translated: whether in a forest, a house,

original: gang du gnas par 'gyur ba der khru gang tshad dam /
analyzed: gang du gnas par 'gyur ba der khru gang tshad dam /
translated: or wherever one will stay, one should make it one cubit in size,

original: khru do'am / khru gsum mam /
analyzed: khru do'am / khru gsum mam /
translated: two cubits, three cubits,

original: lhag par yang bya'o //
analyzed: lhag par yang bya'o //
translated: or even larger.

original: de bzhin du bdug spos dang / tsandan dang / aa ga ru dang / du ru ka dang / kun tu ru'o; ;ba dan kha dog sna tshogs pas dkyil 'khor kun nas brgyan par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdug spos dang / tsandan dang / aa ga ru dang / du ru ka dang / kun tu ru'o; ;ba dan kha dog sna tshogs pas dkyil 'khor kun nas brgyan par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should adorn the entire maṇḍala with various colored banners, incense, sandalwood, agaru, durvā grass, and kuśa grass.

original: me tog phreng ba dgram bya zhing //
analyzed: me tog phreng ba dgram bya zhing //
translated: One should arrange flower garlands,

original: dri dang / byug pa de nyid dang / kun tu mar me'i phreng ba'o //
analyzed: dri dang / byug pa de nyid dang / kun tu mar me'i phreng ba'o //
translated: perfumes, ointments, and a garland of lamps.

original: de nas dri las byas pa'i 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su padma'i ge sar gyi steng du bzhag pa la rig sngags 'chang mngon du phyogs par skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug nas gzhan mi smra bar bzlas brjod brgyad stong brtsam par
analyzed: de nas dri las byas pa'i 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su padma'i ge sar gyi steng du bzhag pa la rig sngags 'chang mngon du phyogs par skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug nas gzhan mi smra bar bzlas brjod brgyad stong brtsam par
translated: Then, in the center of the maṇḍala, one should place the noble Avalokiteśvara made of clay on a lotus pericarp, and the vidyādhara, facing him, should sit cross-legged and recite the mantra eight thousand times without speaking to anyone else.

original: bya'o // brgyad stong rdzogs pa dang / 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi sku las 'od zer sna tshogs 'byung zhing sa cher g-yo bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bya'o // brgyad stong rdzogs pa dang / 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi sku las 'od zer sna tshogs 'byung zhing sa cher g-yo bar 'gyur /
translated: When the recitation is completed, various lights will emerge from the body of the noble Avalokiteśvara, the great earth will quake,

original: rang gi lag pa g-yas pa 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi lag pa g-yas pa 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and one’s right hand will blaze.

original: gzugs brnyan las rig sngags 'chang legs so legs so //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan las rig sngags 'chang legs so legs so //
translated: From the reflection, the knowledge-mantra-holder will hear the words Excellent, excellent!

original: khyod kyis 'dod pa'i las thams cad grub pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis 'dod pa'i las thams cad grub pa'o //
translated: You have accomplished all desired activities.

original: don yod pa chen po'i 'khor lo rnam par 'phrul pa'i dngos grub dang / thams cad du dgos pa grub pa @183b de kho na nyid grub bo //
analyzed: don yod pa chen po'i 'khor lo rnam par 'phrul pa'i dngos grub dang / thams cad du dgos pa grub pa @183b de kho na nyid grub bo //
translated: The accomplishment of the great Amoghacakra's magical power and the accomplishment of all purposes is the accomplishment of reality.

original: khyod kyis don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po 'di mchog tu grub pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po 'di mchog tu grub pa'o //
translated: You have accomplished this essence of Amoghapaśa to the highest degree.

original: khyod kyis sgrub pa'i cho ga rgya cher mchog tu sgrub bo //
analyzed: khyod kyis sgrub pa'i cho ga rgya cher mchog tu sgrub bo //
translated: You have accomplished the extensive ritual of practice to the highest degree.

original: zhes sgra 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes sgra 'byung ngo //
translated: Such sounds will be heard.

original: de nas rig sngags 'chang gi dgos pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga ji ltar dgos par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rig sngags 'chang gi dgos pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga ji ltar dgos par bya ste /
translated: Then, the knowledge-mantra-holder should perform the mandala ritual as needed for the complete accomplishment of his purpose,

original: slob ma gzhug pa dang / dam tshig ni /
analyzed: slob ma gzhug pa dang / dam tshig ni /
translated: admitting the disciples and giving the commitments.

original: 'dir dgos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir dgos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, purpose is what is meant.

original: de nas rig sngags 'chang gang gi tshe dgos pa byung ba de'i tshe dri las byas pa'i mgon po la sngar mchod pa bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rig sngags 'chang gang gi tshe dgos pa byung ba de'i tshe dri las byas pa'i mgon po la sngar mchod pa bya ste /
translated: Then, the knowledge-mantra-holder, whenever the purpose arises, at that time he should make offerings to the Lord made of fragrance, as before.

original: de nas dgos pa thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas dgos pa thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then all needs will be accomplished.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug mdun du bzhag la bzlas brjod brgya rtsa brgyad byas na /
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug mdun du bzhag la bzlas brjod brgya rtsa brgyad byas na /
translated: Placing the noble Avalokiteśvara in front, one should recite [the mantra] one hundred and eight times.

original: dgos pa sna tshogs rmi lam du ston cing /
analyzed: dgos pa sna tshogs rmi lam du ston cing /
translated: He will show various needs in a dream.

original: ji ltar bsam pa thams cad ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar bsam pa thams cad ston par 'gyur te /
translated: He will show all that is thought.

original: de'i mdun du tsandan dkar po las dkyil 'khor byas la /
analyzed: de'i mdun du tsandan dkar po las dkyil 'khor byas la /
translated: In front of him, one should make a maṇḍala out of white sandalwood.

original: tsandan dkar po'i sbyin sreg brgya rtsa brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: tsandan dkar po'i sbyin sreg brgya rtsa brgyad bya'o //
translated: One should offer into the fire one hundred and eight oblations of white sandalwood.

original: de nas thal ba la bzlas brjod lan brgya rtsa brgyad bya ste /
analyzed: de nas thal ba la bzlas brjod lan brgya rtsa brgyad bya ste /
translated: Then, one should recite [the mantra] one hundred and eight times over the ashes.

original: rang gi lus mtha' dag khyab par bsku zhing /
analyzed: rang gi lus mtha' dag khyab par bsku zhing /
translated: One should anoint one’s entire body with the ashes.

original: thal ba de nyid dang / yungs kar gyi byug pa phyogs bzhir gtor na /
analyzed: thal ba de nyid dang / yungs kar gyi byug pa phyogs bzhir gtor na /
translated: Having scattered the ashes and mustard seed in the four directions,

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzugs ji ltar de ltar 'jig rten thams cad kyis mngon sum du mthong ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzugs ji ltar de ltar 'jig rten thams cad kyis mngon sum du mthong ste /
translated: all worlds will perceive [one] in the form of Lokeśvara.

original: ji srid du phyir bsdu ba ma byas pa de srid du 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzugs su snang bar 'gyur ro //🔽dri chu dang yungs kar gyis mngon du @184a *//
analyzed: ji srid du phyir bsdu ba ma byas pa de srid du 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzugs su snang bar 'gyur ro // dri chu dang yungs kar gyis mngon du @184a *//
translated: As long as one does not withdraw, one will appear in the form of Lokeśvara.

original: phyogs par gtor na phyir bsdu ba byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs par gtor na phyir bsdu ba byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one scatters mustard seeds and water in the direction of the target, the withdrawal will be accomplished.

original: thal ba des rab tu bdugs te dur khrod kyi nang du zhugs na /
analyzed: thal ba des rab tu bdugs te dur khrod kyi nang du zhugs na /
translated: If one fumigates with that ash and enters a charnel ground,

original: 'byung po'i dbung dang / 'khor dang bcas pa mdun na nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byung po'i dbung dang / 'khor dang bcas pa mdun na nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: the hosts of bhūtas, together with their retinues, will stand before one.

original: gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / 'byung po dang / sha za thams cad mdun na nye bar gnas shing dbang du gyur nas gnas te bdag dang nor gyis bgyi ba ci mchis zhes bya ba byed do //🔽rang la byugs te tshogs kyi nang ngam /
analyzed: gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / 'byung po dang / sha za thams cad mdun na nye bar gnas shing dbang du gyur nas gnas te bdag dang nor gyis bgyi ba ci mchis zhes bya ba byed do // rang la byugs te tshogs kyi nang ngam /
translated: All the yakṣas, rākṣasas, bhūtas, and piśācas will stand before one, under one’s control, and will say, ‘What shall we do? What is to be done?’🔽If one anoints oneself with it and enters an assembly

original: dge 'dun gyi nang du zhugs na /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nang du zhugs na /
translated: or the saṅgha,

original: ston pa mthong ba ji lta ba de ltar rig sngags 'chang snang zhing mthong ste /
analyzed: ston pa mthong ba ji lta ba de ltar rig sngags 'chang snang zhing mthong ste /
translated: the mantra adept will appear and be seen just as the Teacher was seen.

original: mchod pa'i 'os chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchod pa'i 'os chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become worthy of great worship.

original: phyag bya ba'i 'os su 'gyur /
analyzed: phyag bya ba'i 'os su 'gyur /
translated: He will be worthy of homage.

original: don dang mchod pa chen po 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dang mchod pa chen po 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will obtain great wealth and great worship.

original: thal bas lus bskus te klu'i mtshor zhugs na /
analyzed: thal bas lus bskus te klu'i mtshor zhugs na /
translated: If one smears one’s body with ashes and enters the nāga lake,

original: klu'i rgyal po stong phrag drug cu rtsa brgyad thams cad dbang du gyur nas gnas te bka' bzhin byed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po stong phrag drug cu rtsa brgyad thams cad dbang du gyur nas gnas te bka' bzhin byed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: all sixty-eight thousand nāga kings will be brought under control and will remain there, obeying his every command.

original: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will remain close by for as long as one lives.

original: rang la byugs te rgyal po'i pho brang du zhugs na /
analyzed: rang la byugs te rgyal po'i pho brang du zhugs na /
translated: If one smears oneself and enters the king’s palace,

original: rgyal po'i btsun mo dang 'khor du bcas pa rnams dbang du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyal po'i btsun mo dang 'khor du bcas pa rnams dbang du 'gyur te /
translated: the king’s queen and retinue will be brought under control.

original: ci bgyi zhes bya ba byed cing mdun na nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci bgyi zhes bya ba byed cing mdun na nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will do whatever one says and remain close by.

original: 'jig rten gyi bla ma ji lta ba de bzhin du mchod pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bla ma ji lta ba de bzhin du mchod pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Great worship will arise, just as with the world’s guru.

original: don chen po dang mchod pa chen po 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don chen po dang mchod pa chen po 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will obtain great wealth and great worship.

original: ji srid @184b 'tsho'i bar du nye bar gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji srid @184b 'tsho'i bar du nye bar gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: They will remain close by for as long as one lives,

original: ston pa 'dren pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ston pa 'dren pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: just like the teacher and guide.

original: gang dang gang la thal bas reg pa tsam gyis de dang de'i nad thams cad bral bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang dang gang la thal bas reg pa tsam gyis de dang de'i nad thams cad bral bar 'gyur /
translated: Wherever the ashes fall, all the diseases there will be removed.

original: sdig pa dang sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag par 'gyur /
analyzed: sdig pa dang sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag par 'gyur /
translated: All the sins and obscurations will be purified.

original: ngan 'gro'i sgo thams cad bcad par 'gyur /
analyzed: ngan 'gro'i sgo thams cad bcad par 'gyur /
translated: All the doors to the lower realms will be closed.

original: mchog tu bde ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchog tu bde ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be endowed with supreme bliss.

original: shi 'phos nas bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shi 'phos nas bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After death, they will be reborn in the world system of Sukhāvatī.

original: byas pa mi gzo ba /
analyzed: byas pa mi gzo ba /
translated: Those who are ungrateful,

original: gsang sngags kyi gdol pa /
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi gdol pa /
translated: those who are outcastes of the mantra,

original: ma gus pa /
analyzed: ma gus pa /
translated: those who are disrespectful,

original: bla ma mi byed pa /
analyzed: bla ma mi byed pa /
translated: those who do not honor their gurus,

original: rlom sems dang nga rgyal dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rlom sems dang nga rgyal dang ldan pa /
translated: those who are conceited and proud,

original: bdud kyi phyogs pa /
analyzed: bdud kyi phyogs pa /
translated: those who are on the side of Māra,

original: skyes bu gti mug can /
analyzed: skyes bu gti mug can /
translated: those who are deluded,

original: gsog pa la zhen pa /
analyzed: gsog pa la zhen pa /
translated: those who are attached to hoarding,🔽those who are arrogant and proud—

original: khengs pa / nga rgyal can de dag gis gang du yang dngos grub yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: khengs pa / nga rgyal can de dag gis gang du yang dngos grub yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: they will not see any accomplishments anywhere.

original: de dag yun ring por thar pa mi rnyed pas dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / gang yang rig sngags kyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyis smad pa /
analyzed: de dag yun ring por thar pa mi rnyed pas dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / gang yang rig sngags kyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyis smad pa /
translated: Since they do not attain liberation for a long time, they are despised by the Tathāgatas of the three times, the bodhisattvas, and also the deities of the maṇḍala of the knowledge mantra.

original: skye ba rgyud la dngos grub bsregs pa /
analyzed: skye ba rgyud la dngos grub bsregs pa /
translated: [They] burn the continuum of birth and the accomplishments.

original: 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol chud gson pa dag ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol chud gson pa dag ni /
translated: [They] are lost in this world and the next.

original: ma gtogs te /
analyzed: ma gtogs te /
translated: [They] are excluded.

original: de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi /
translated: However,

original: 'dir bdag gis cung zad kyang ma nongs te /
analyzed: 'dir bdag gis cung zad kyang ma nongs te /
translated: here I have not erred in the least.

original: sdug bsngal mang po dang chen po'i sems can dgrol bar rngo mi thogs lags so //🔽sangs rgyas thugs rje chen pos bka' stsal pa'i yid la bgyi bskal pa bgrangs par yid la @185a *//
analyzed: sdug bsngal mang po dang chen po'i sems can dgrol bar rngo mi thogs lags so // sangs rgyas thugs rje chen pos bka' stsal pa'i yid la bgyi bskal pa bgrangs par yid la @185a *//
translated: I am unable to liberate beings with much suffering and great suffering.

original: bgyis pas dgrol bar rngo mi thogs lags so //
analyzed: bgyis pas dgrol bar rngo mi thogs lags so //
translated: The Buddha, with great compassion, has taught the mental engagements that, when mentally engaged for eons, are unable to liberate.

original: de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi /
translated: However,

original: sdug bsngal mang po brgyud par nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mang po brgyud par nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: [they] will experience many successive sufferings.

original: dngos grub ni /
analyzed: dngos grub ni /
translated: Accomplishments

original: byams pas 'thob ste /
analyzed: byams pas 'thob ste /
translated: are obtained through love.

original: byams pa dang gsang sngags kyi go cha bgos pa /
analyzed: byams pa dang gsang sngags kyi go cha bgos pa /
translated: He is clad in the armor of love and secret mantra.

original: byams pa'i ral gri thogs pa /
analyzed: byams pa'i ral gri thogs pa /
translated: He wields the sword of love.

original: sems can thams cad la phan zhing mnyes gshin pa la de kho na nyid sgrub pa'i dngos grub 'di dag 'jig rten 'dren pas rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan zhing mnyes gshin pa la de kho na nyid sgrub pa'i dngos grub 'di dag 'jig rten 'dren pas rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: These accomplishments of the attainment of suchness are granted by the guides of the world to all beings who are kind and dear.

original: mgon po 'di mthong ba tsam gyis spos kyi gzugs kyi 'jig rten mgon po mthong ba dang / 'jig rten 'dren pa rang gi gzugs su mngon sum du mthong ba mtshungs pa nyid du khong du chud par bgyi'o //
analyzed: mgon po 'di mthong ba tsam gyis spos kyi gzugs kyi 'jig rten mgon po mthong ba dang / 'jig rten 'dren pa rang gi gzugs su mngon sum du mthong ba mtshungs pa nyid du khong du chud par bgyi'o //
translated: By merely seeing this lord, one should understand that seeing the world protectors in the form of incense is the same as seeing the guides of the world in their own forms.

original: sangs rgyas bye ba gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam par mngon sum du mthong ba kho na dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po mthong ba mtshungs pa kho nar khong du chud par bgyi ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bye ba gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam par mngon sum du mthong ba kho na dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po mthong ba mtshungs pa kho nar khong du chud par bgyi ste /
translated: One should understand that seeing ten million buddhas is the same as seeing the world protectors.

original: 'di ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know this.

translated: Then, Ārya Avalokiteśvara, extending his hand, takes the knowledge-mantra holder's hand and causes him to enter into the mandala. He unties from his own neck a jewel called Shining Very Pure

analyzed: @207b don yod pa lhun po'i snying po yangs pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs dang / don yod pa dri ma med pa'i padma zhes bya ba'i gzungs dang / don yod ba'i 'od zer rab tu snang ba zhes bya ba'i gzungs dang / don yod pa'i yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba'i gzungs dang /
translated: the dhāraṇī called “Wish-Fulfilling Jeweled Banner of Immovable,”🔽the dhāraṇī called “Light Rays of Immovable Transformation,”🔽the dhāraṇī called “Seal of Immovable,”🔽the dhāraṇī called “Vajra of Immovable,”

translated: the dhāraṇī called “Infinite Meaning,” the dhāraṇī called “Meaningful Attainment,” the dhāraṇī called “Source of Stainless Meaning,” the dhāraṇī called “Expansion of Meaningful Mind,”

analyzed: don yod pa'i 'bar ba'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i gzungs dang / don yod pa nyi ma'i snying po zhes bya ba'i gzungs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor gsang ba don yod pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs 'thob ste /
translated: the dhāraṇī called “Meaningful Blazing Mudrā,” the dhāraṇī called “Meaningful Essence of the Sun,” and the dhāraṇī called “Secret Maṇḍala of All Tathāgatas and Bodhisattvas.”

original: gang gis gzungs de rnams thos pa tsam gyis don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis phyag byas pa /
analyzed: gang gis gzungs de rnams thos pa tsam gyis don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis phyag byas pa /
translated: By merely hearing those dhāraṇīs, one attains the essence of Amoghapaśa, which is revered by all bodhisattvas.

original: rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags rim par phye ba'i dkyil 'khor mtha' dag rdzogs pa dang / gsang @208a *//
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags rim par phye ba'i dkyil 'khor mtha' dag rdzogs pa dang / gsang @208a *//
translated: the maṇḍala of the seal of liberation, the complete maṇḍala of the divisions of the mantra,

original: sngags dang / cho ga dang / cho ga zhib mo rgya chen po kha ton du gnas shing thams cad so so yang dag par shes te /
analyzed: sngags dang / cho ga dang / cho ga zhib mo rgya chen po kha ton du gnas shing thams cad so so yang dag par shes te /
translated: the mantra, the ritual, and the extensive ritual manual that are present as recitations, and all of them are understood individually.

original: gang gis mthu 'di rab tu thob pa'i rmongs pa skyes par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis mthu 'di rab tu thob pa'i rmongs pa skyes par 'gyur /
translated: How could delusion arise for one who has attained this power?

original: dran pa nyams par mi 'gyur /🔽dran pa zhan par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dran pa nyams par mi 'gyur / dran pa zhan par mi 'gyur /
translated: There will be no loss of mindfulness.🔽There will be no weakness of mindfulness.

original: dran pa rmugs par mi 'gyur /🔽dran pa 'khums par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dran pa rmugs par mi 'gyur / dran pa 'khums par mi 'gyur /
translated: There will be no dullness of mindfulness.🔽There will be no contraction of mindfulness.

original: dran pa mi brtan par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dran pa mi brtan par mi 'gyur /
translated: There will be no instability of mindfulness.

original: dran pa gzhan du rgyu bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dran pa gzhan du rgyu bar mi 'gyur /
translated: There will be no wandering of mindfulness elsewhere.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / ser sna dang / phrag dog gi rjes su 'gro bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / ser sna dang / phrag dog gi rjes su 'gro bar mi 'gyur /
translated: There will be no following of desire, anger, ignorance, pride, miserliness, or jealousy.

original: dran pa sdig pa can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa sdig pa can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: There will be no sinful mindfulness.

original: dran pa 'jig rten pa'i mi dge ba byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dran pa 'jig rten pa'i mi dge ba byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They will not engage in nonvirtuous worldly activities.

original: rtag tu blo yangs shing rab tu gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu blo yangs shing rab tu gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Their minds will always be vast and clear.

original: rtag tu mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i dran pa dang / blo rgya mtsho lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i dran pa dang / blo rgya mtsho lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: They will always have a mindfulness that is equal to the unequaled, and their minds will be like the ocean.

original: rtag tu dran pa zab cing rgya mtsho chen po bsags pa lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu dran pa zab cing rgya mtsho chen po bsags pa lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: Their mindfulness will always be deep, like the accumulation of a great ocean.

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /
translated: Vajrapāṇi,

original: don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po'i gzungs cho ga zhib mo'i rgyal po de ltar go skabs yangs pa la gang gis gzungs 'di thob pa de lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po'i gzungs cho ga zhib mo'i rgyal po de ltar go skabs yangs pa la gang gis gzungs 'di thob pa de lag na rdo rje /
translated: Vajrapāṇi, those who obtain this dhāraṇī in this way, through the king of manuals of the uṣṇīṣ cakravartī dhāraṇī, will have a vast opportunity.

original: ji ltar dran pa rmongs par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar dran pa rmongs par 'gyur /
translated: Vajrapāṇi, how could their mindfulness be confused?

original: gzhan yang tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa'i lus yongs su dag pa dang / yid yongs su dag pa dang / sems yongs su dag pa dang / mdangs yongs su dag pa dang / mig yongs su dag pa dang / @208b rna ba yongs su dag pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa'i lus yongs su dag pa dang / yid yongs su dag pa dang / sems yongs su dag pa dang / mdangs yongs su dag pa dang / mig yongs su dag pa dang / @208b rna ba yongs su dag pa dang /
translated: Moreover, they will have immeasurable, countless, unfathomable pure bodies, pure minds, pure thoughts, pure radiance, pure eyes, pure ears,

original: sna yongs su dag pa dang / lce yongs su dag pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sna yongs su dag pa dang / lce yongs su dag pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will attain a pure nose and a pure tongue.

original: don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po bklags pa tsam dang / mnyan pa tsam dang / mthong ba tsam dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa tsam gyis de rnams yon tan gyi phan yon chen po 'di 'thob ste /
analyzed: don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po bklags pa tsam dang / mnyan pa tsam dang / mthong ba tsam dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa tsam gyis de rnams yon tan gyi phan yon chen po 'di 'thob ste /
translated: By merely reciting, merely listening to, merely seeing, or merely aspiring to the essence of Amoghapaśa, they will attain these great benefits of qualities.

original: gang gis mthu 'di rab tu thob pa de la lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: gang gis mthu 'di rab tu thob pa de la lag na rdo rje /
translated: To whomsoever this power is granted, Vajrapāṇi,

original: ji ltar rmongs pa skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar rmongs pa skye bar 'gyur /
translated: how could delusion arise?

original: de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi /
translated: Nevertheless,

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /
translated: Vajrapāṇi,

original: yud tsam zhig sdod cig dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor mang po'i dbus su ji ltar mngon sum du 'gyur ba bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar bab par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: yud tsam zhig sdod cig dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor mang po'i dbus su ji ltar mngon sum du 'gyur ba bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar bab par bstan par bya'o //
translated: wait a moment, and I will demonstrate in the presence of the Blessed One how this will be directly perceived in the midst of the assembly of the Tathāgata.

original: don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis phyag byas pa /
analyzed: don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis phyag byas pa /
translated: The essence of Amoghapaśa, revered by all bodhisattvas,

original: rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga rnam par 'phrul pa'i cho 'phrul gyi rdzu 'phrul dam pa'i yul gyi mthu chen po'i chen po bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga rnam par 'phrul pa'i cho 'phrul gyi rdzu 'phrul dam pa'i yul gyi mthu chen po'i chen po bstan par bya'o //
translated: I will teach the maṇḍala ritual of liberation, the display of the miraculous power of emanation, the great power of the domain of the supreme miraculous power.”

original: de nas gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon chen po phyag na rdo rje byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi drung nas don yod pa'i yon tan bkod pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di dag dang /
analyzed: de nas gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon chen po phyag na rdo rje byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi drung nas don yod pa'i yon tan bkod pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di dag dang /
translated: Then, the great yakṣa general Vajrapāṇi, having directly heard from the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ārya Avalokiteśvara these samādhis of the display of the array of Amogha­guṇa­dhātu

original: gzungs kyi sgo 'di dag mngon sum du thos nas dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / yid rangs pa dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / yid bde ba skyes te /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo 'di dag mngon sum du thos nas dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / yid rangs pa dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / yid bde ba skyes te /
translated: and these dhāraṇī gateways, was delighted, pleased, overjoyed, and delighted,

original: snying dga' bas dga' ba chen po nyid @209a *//
analyzed: snying dga' bas dga' ba chen po nyid @209a *//
translated: and with a joyful heart he attained great joy.

original: thob par gyur nas smras pa /
analyzed: thob par gyur nas smras pa /
translated: He said:

original: bdag lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pas yongs su dga' ba yid la bgyid pas nges par gnas par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pas yongs su dga' ba yid la bgyid pas nges par gnas par bgyi'o //
translated: “I will abide with a mind that delights in the complete purification of body and mind.

original: yid la bgyid pa mchog tu dga' ba dang / ngo mtshar du gyur pa dang / som nyir du gyur pa dang bral ba dang / 'gyod pa ma mchis pas gnas par bgyi'o //
analyzed: yid la bgyid pa mchog tu dga' ba dang / ngo mtshar du gyur pa dang / som nyir du gyur pa dang bral ba dang / 'gyod pa ma mchis pas gnas par bgyi'o //
translated: and without regret.

original: rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis phyag bgyis pa /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis phyag bgyis pa /
translated: The maṇḍala of liberation, revered by all bodhisattvas,

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po'i mthu'i rnam par 'phrul pa 'di ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po'i mthu'i rnam par 'phrul pa 'di ni /
translated: this essence of the invincible noose of noble Avalokiteśvara,

original: mchog tu rnyed par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu rnyed par dka' ba'o //
translated: is supremely difficult to obtain.🔽Then, the great yakṣa general Vajrapāṇi, having offered the stainless all-illuminating great precious jewel to the noble bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara,

original: de nas gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon chen po phyag na rdo rjes byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la dri ma med par kun tu snang ba'i nor bu rin po che chen po chos kyi dga' bar phul nas rkang
analyzed: de nas gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon chen po phyag na rdo rjes byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la dri ma med par kun tu snang ba'i nor bu rin po che chen po chos kyi dga' bar phul nas rkang
translated: with his right knee🔽touching the ground,

original: pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag byas te lan gsum bskor ba byas nas song ste ched du brjod pa 'di ched du brjod cing /
analyzed: pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag byas te lan gsum bskor ba byas nas song ste ched du brjod pa 'di ched du brjod cing /
translated: He bowed his head to the feet of the two of them, circumambulated them three times, and departed.

original: 'gying bag dang / brjid bag gi 'gros kyis song nas rang gi stan la 'dug ste bzhin 'dzum pas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal du bltas nas snying yongs su dga' bas bcom ldan 'das la rtog cing 'dug go /🔽de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang @209b phyug ngo mtshar mchog tu rmad du byung ba /
analyzed: 'gying bag dang / brjid bag gi 'gros kyis song nas rang gi stan la 'dug ste bzhin 'dzum pas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal du bltas nas snying yongs su dga' bas bcom ldan 'das la rtog cing 'dug go / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang @209b phyug ngo mtshar mchog tu rmad du byung ba /
translated: He went with a gait of pride and majesty, sat on his own seat, and with a smiling face looked at the face of the Bhagavān and remained contemplating the Bhagavān with a joyful heart.

original: snying rje dam pa rgya chen po'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'i dmigs pas sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i phyir 'od zer dri ma med par snang ba'i nor bu rin po che chen po de phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phul te nam mkha' la 'phags
analyzed: snying rje dam pa rgya chen po'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'i dmigs pas sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i phyir 'od zer dri ma med par snang ba'i nor bu rin po che chen po de phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phul te nam mkha' la 'phags
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ārya Avalokiteśvara, with a mind of great compassion, with a mind of great compassion that was the focus of his superior intention, which was a supreme and vast compassion, in order to liberate all beings, offered that great precious jewel that was the light of stainless radiance to all the tathāgatas in the ten directions and rose up into the sky.

original: so // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags ba spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis nor bu rin po che de nam mkha'i dkyil du 'phags ma thag tu stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di cher g-yos par gyur to //
analyzed: so // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags ba spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis nor bu rin po che de nam mkha'i dkyil du 'phags ma thag tu stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di cher g-yos par gyur to //
translated: As soon as the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara threw that precious jewel into the sky, this trichiliocosm shook greatly.

original: 'od zer gyi snang ba chen po nyi ma bye ba brgya stong bas lhag pa'i 'od zer byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: 'od zer gyi snang ba chen po nyi ma bye ba brgya stong bas lhag pa'i 'od zer byung bar gyur to //
translated: A great radiance appeared, surpassing the light of a hundred thousand myriads of suns.

original: snang ba gang gis 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad kyi lus la reg pa tsam gyis sdig pa thams cad dang / dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du ngan song gi 'gro ba las yongs su grol bar gyur to //
analyzed: snang ba gang gis 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad kyi lus la reg pa tsam gyis sdig pa thams cad dang / dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du ngan song gi 'gro ba las yongs su grol bar gyur to //
translated: By that light, all beings in Jambudvīpa were touched by it, and all their sins were eliminated. They were freed from the destinies of the lower realms, such as the hells, hungry ghosts, animals, and the world of Yama.

original: gang yang gling bzhi pa'i yi dvags dang / dmyal ba de dag la yang snang ba des snang bar gyur pas nyi tshe ba'i dmyal ba rnams kyi gtubs pa med par gyur te /🔽sems can de dag kyang yongs su thar nas bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su skal ba mnyam par skyes te /
analyzed: gang yang gling bzhi pa'i yi dvags dang / dmyal ba de dag la yang snang ba des snang bar gyur pas nyi tshe ba'i dmyal ba rnams kyi gtubs pa med par gyur te / sems can de dag kyang yongs su thar nas bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su skal ba mnyam par skyes te /
translated: The light also shone on the hungry ghosts and hell beings of the four continents, and the light of the momentary hells was extinguished.

original: lus yongs su dag par gyur to //
analyzed: lus yongs su dag par gyur to //
translated: Those beings were liberated and were reborn in the realm of Sukhāvatī, where they were born miraculously, fully endowed with all the major and minor body parts.

original: gang yang mnar med ba'i dmyal ba chen po bcu drug po de @210a *//
analyzed: gang yang mnar med ba'i dmyal ba chen po bcu drug po de @210a *//
translated: The light also shone on the sixteen great hells of Avīci,

original: dag 'od zer gyi snang ba des reg pas dmyal ba de dag thams cad du padma'i mtsho byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: dag 'od zer gyi snang ba des reg pas dmyal ba de dag thams cad du padma'i mtsho byung bar gyur te /
translated: and the light touched them all, causing lotus ponds to appear in those hells.

original: sems can de dag kyang yongs su thar nas rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan te bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su skal ba mnyam par padma las brdzus te skyes so //
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang yongs su thar nas rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan te bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su skal ba mnyam par padma las brdzus te skyes so //
translated: Those beings were liberated and were adorned with all ornaments. They were born miraculously in the realm of Sukhāvatī, where they were born miraculously, fully endowed with all the major and minor body parts.

original: grang ba'i dmyal ba gang yin pa de dag kyang dro zhing bde ba dang / reg na bde bar gyur to //
analyzed: grang ba'i dmyal ba gang yin pa de dag kyang dro zhing bde ba dang / reg na bde bar gyur to //
translated: The cold hells became warm and pleasant to the touch.

original: tsha ba'i dmyal ba gang yin pa de dag kyang bsil bar gyur cing reg na bde ba dang / rab tu dga' par gyur to //
analyzed: tsha ba'i dmyal ba gang yin pa de dag kyang bsil bar gyur cing reg na bde ba dang / rab tu dga' par gyur to //
translated: The hot hells became cool and pleasant to the touch.

original: gang yang dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba ri dvags dang / bya dang / tha na sbrang bu dang / sha sbrang dag kyang 'od zer des reg pas dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba de dag thams cad dga' ldan du lha rnams kyi nang du skyes so //
analyzed: gang yang dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba ri dvags dang / bya dang / tha na sbrang bu dang / sha sbrang dag kyang 'od zer des reg pas dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba de dag thams cad dga' ldan du lha rnams kyi nang du skyes so //
translated: The animals, birds, and even insects and worms that were touched by the light of the Tathāgata were all reborn among the Tuṣita devas.

original: sems can gang dag bcings par gyur pa de dag kyang 'od zer des reg pas sems can bcings pa las yongs su grol bar gyur to //
analyzed: sems can gang dag bcings par gyur pa de dag kyang 'od zer des reg pas sems can bcings pa las yongs su grol bar gyur to //
translated: Those beings who were bound were freed from their bonds by the light of the Tathāgata.

original: su mi 'dod pa dang / lcags sgrog dang / lcags kyu lu gu rgyud kyis bcings pa de dag kyang dum bur gyur to //
analyzed: su mi 'dod pa dang / lcags sgrog dang / lcags kyu lu gu rgyud kyis bcings pa de dag kyang dum bur gyur to //
translated: Those who were in fetters, chains, or shackles had them broken.

original: gang snod ma yin pa de yang 'od zer des phog pas mthong ba yongs su dag pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: gang snod ma yin pa de yang 'od zer des phog pas mthong ba yongs su dag pa 'thob bo //
translated: Those who were not suitable vessels became suitable vessels, and their vision became pure.

analyzed: gang sha bkra dang mdze'i nad kyis lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / rna ba dang / sna ma tshang ba yang 'od zer des phog pas lus yongs su rdzogs pa dang / lus mongs su dag par gyur @210b to; ;gang 'bras bu'i shing ljon pa dang /

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gtogs pa gang du 'od zer bab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gtogs pa de na yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing so so'i de  gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag gang+g'a'i
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gtogs pa gang du 'od zer bab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gtogs pa de na yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing so so'i de  gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag gang+g'a'i
translated: In all the buddha-fields where the light shone, in each buddha-field there were hundreds of thousands of quintillions of buddhas, as many as there are sand-grains in the Ganges River, who had attained supreme perfect enlightenment that very day.

original: klung gi bye ma dgu bcu rtsa dgu snyed bzhugs te /

analyzed: bdag gi snying po gsang ba /

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'khor 'di'i nang du 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi snying po don yod pa'i lcags kyu'i bya ba'i yo byad dang / cho ga bshad do //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'khor 'di'i nang du 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi snying po don yod pa'i lcags kyu'i bya ba'i yo byad dang / cho ga bshad do //
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ārya Avalokiteśvara, in the presence of the Blessed One, explained in this assembly the ritual implements and method of the essence of Ārya Avalokiteśvara, the Amogha-pāśa:

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽de nas rig sngags 'chang gang 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi snying po don yod pa'i zhags pa byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis phyag bgyis pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / de nas rig sngags 'chang gang 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi snying po don yod pa'i zhags pa byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis phyag bgyis pa /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rnam par thar ba'i dkyil 'khor 'di sgrub par 'tshal ba dang / gang yang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rnam par thar ba'i dkyil 'khor 'di sgrub par 'tshal ba dang / gang yang rigs kyi bu'am /
