original: rigs kyi bu mo'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo'am /
translated: or daughter of good family,

original: dge slong pha'am /
analyzed: dge slong pha'am /
translated: or monk,

original: dge slong ma'am /
analyzed: dge slong ma'am /
translated: or nun,

original: dge bsnyen nam /
analyzed: dge bsnyen nam /
translated: or layman,

original: dge bsnyen ma'am /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma'am /
translated: or laywoman,

original: dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: dge sbyong ngam /
translated: or ascetic,🔽or brahmin,

original: bram ze'am / rgyal rigs sam /🔽rje'u rigs sam /
analyzed: bram ze'am / rgyal rigs sam / rje'u rigs sam /
translated: or kṣatriya,🔽or vaiśya,

original: dmangs rigs sam /
analyzed: dmangs rigs sam /
translated: or śūdra,

original: gzhan su yang rung ba bdu med dam /
analyzed: gzhan su yang rung ba bdu med dam /
translated: or any other being,🔽whether male,🔽female,🔽child,

original: skyes ba'am / khye'u'am /
analyzed: skyes ba'am / khye'u'am /
translated: or infant,

original: bu mo'am / don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po 'di bklag par 'tshal ba dang / bstan par 'tshal ba dang / bzlas brjod kyi cho ga bgyi bar 'tshal ba dang / mtha' dag rdzogs pa @216a *//
analyzed: bu mo'am / don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po 'di bklag par 'tshal ba dang / bstan par 'tshal ba dang / bzlas brjod kyi cho ga bgyi bar 'tshal ba dang / mtha' dag rdzogs pa @216a *//
translated: who wishes to read this essence of Amoghapaśa, wishes to teach it, wishes to perform the ritual of recitation, or wishes to accomplish it in its entirety,

original: sgrub par 'tshal ba des sngon rol tu phyogs bcur thal mo sbyar te phyag 'tshal nas shar phyogs su kha bltas te mchis la gzhan mi smra bar don yod pa'i lcags kyu'i snying po 'di lan gsum dran par bgyi zhing /
analyzed: sgrub par 'tshal ba des sngon rol tu phyogs bcur thal mo sbyar te phyag 'tshal nas shar phyogs su kha bltas te mchis la gzhan mi smra bar don yod pa'i lcags kyu'i snying po 'di lan gsum dran par bgyi zhing /
translated: should first join the palms together in the ten directions, pay homage, face east, and without speaking to others, should recall this essence of Amoghapaśa three times.

original: yang thal mo sbyar te phyag bgyi'o //
analyzed: yang thal mo sbyar te phyag bgyi'o //
translated: Again, one should join the palms together and pay homage.

original: des na dran pa tsam gyi mdo la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bkug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na dran pa tsam gyi mdo la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bkug par 'gyur te /
translated: Then, merely by recalling it, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ārya Avalokiteśvara will be summoned.

original: ri bo po ta la'i gzhal med khang dang bcas pa dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang bcas pa bkug par 'gyur ro ////
analyzed: ri bo po ta la'i gzhal med khang dang bcas pa dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang bcas pa bkug par 'gyur ro ////
translated: the palace of Mount Potala together with the maṇḍala of the retinue, and the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas will be summoned.

original: 'phags ba don yod pa'i zhags pa'i cho ga zhib mo'i rgyal po /
analyzed: 'phags ba don yod pa'i zhags pa'i cho ga zhib mo'i rgyal po /
translated: The king of extensive manuals of the ritual of the noble Amoghapaśa,

original: bam po nyi shu gnyis pa /
analyzed: bam po nyi shu gnyis pa /
translated: the twenty-second section.

original: don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis phyag bgyis pa /
analyzed: don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis phyag bgyis pa /
translated: The essence of Amoghapaśa, revered by all bodhisattvas,

original: rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor phyag rgya dang bcas pa gsang sngags rim par phye ba'i cho ga zhib mo dang / sgrub pa'i cho ga'i rnam pa rgya chen po mtha' dag rdzogs pa 'di yang bkug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor phyag rgya dang bcas pa gsang sngags rim par phye ba'i cho ga zhib mo dang / sgrub pa'i cho ga'i rnam pa rgya chen po mtha' dag rdzogs pa 'di yang bkug par 'gyur ro //
translated: together with the maṇḍala of liberation and the seal, the extensive manual of the division of the mantra, and the complete extensive form of the ritual of accomplishment will also be summoned.

original: dkyil 'khor gnas pa'i rig sngags kyi lha 'khor dang bcas pa bkug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gnas pa'i rig sngags kyi lha 'khor dang bcas pa bkug par 'gyur te /
translated: The mantra deity residing in the maṇḍala together with the retinue will be summoned.

original: thams cad yid rab tu dga' bar gyur pas dngos grub dam @216b pa rjes su stsol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad yid rab tu dga' bar gyur pas dngos grub dam @216b pa rjes su stsol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All will be delighted and will grant the highest spiritual powers.

original: de nas don yod pa'i rgyal po'i snying po dran par bgyi ste /
analyzed: de nas don yod pa'i rgyal po'i snying po dran par bgyi ste /
translated: Then one should recall the essence mantra of Amogharaaja.

original: ji ltar shin tu rgya cher yid la bgyis pa de ltar sgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar shin tu rgya cher yid la bgyis pa de ltar sgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: As one does so, one will accomplish whatever one has in mind.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug nyid kyi kha nas dran pa mnyan zhing rgya che ba dang / blo dang mdangs dri ma ma mchis pa 'jug par bgyid de /
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug nyid kyi kha nas dran pa mnyan zhing rgya che ba dang / blo dang mdangs dri ma ma mchis pa 'jug par bgyid de /
translated: Avalokitesvara himself will enter one's mouth, and one will hear his vast recollection.

original: zhugs pa tsam gyi mod la lce padma'i 'dab ma lta bur 'jam par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: zhugs pa tsam gyi mod la lce padma'i 'dab ma lta bur 'jam par 'gyur zhing /
translated: As soon as he enters, one's tongue will become soft like a lotus petal.

original: kha nas autpa la'i dri 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha nas autpa la'i dri 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The scent of utpala will emerge from one's mouth.

original: dbyangs snyan cing mnyen pa dang / 'jam pa dang / zab pa dang / tshig rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyangs snyan cing mnyen pa dang / 'jam pa dang / zab pa dang / tshig rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: One's voice will become melodious, gentle, soft, deep, and pure.

original: mi'am ci'i dbyangs dang / sgra snyan pa dang / dbyangs mnyen pa dang / dga' bar byed pa'i dbyangs su 'gyur zhing ka la pinga ka'i dbyangs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi'am ci'i dbyangs dang / sgra snyan pa dang / dbyangs mnyen pa dang / dga' bar byed pa'i dbyangs su 'gyur zhing ka la pinga ka'i dbyangs su 'gyur ro //
translated: One will have the voice of a kinnara, a pleasant voice, a soft voice, a delightful voice, and a voice like the kalaviṅka bird.

original: ci ste dus gsum du dran par bgyid na; gsang sngags dang / cho ga zhib mo dang / dkyil 'khor dang / phyag rgya rim par phye ba dang / cho ga thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs spyi'i dngos grub de rdzogs par 'gyur zhing spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste dus gsum du dran par bgyid na; gsang sngags dang / cho ga zhib mo dang / dkyil 'khor dang / phyag rgya rim par phye ba dang / cho ga thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs spyi'i dngos grub de rdzogs par 'gyur zhing spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites it three times a day, all the mantras, the detailed rites, the maṇḍalas, the divisions of the mudrās, all the rites, and the common accomplishments of all the tathāgatas will be perfected and will be practiced.

original: bgegs dang / log 'dren dang / bdud la sogs pa sdang ba'i 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bgegs dang / log 'dren dang / bdud la sogs pa sdang ba'i 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be free from all the fears of obstacles, evil forces, and māras.

original: sngon gyi sgrib pa dang / dmyal bar mchi ba'i sdig pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi sgrib pa dang / dmyal bar mchi ba'i sdig pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be free from all the obscurations of the past and from all the sins that lead to rebirth in hell.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi snying po /
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi snying po /
translated: The essence of noble Avalokiteśvara,

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal po chen @217a *//
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal po chen @217a *//
translated: the great king of vidyā mantras,

original: po don yod pa'i lcags kyu 'di lan gsum dran par bgyis pa tsam gyis skad cig de nyid kyi mod la bdag rang dang / rang gzhan kyi dang / slob ma dang / bsnyen bkur dang / 'khor dang bcas pa mi gtsang ba yang gtsang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: po don yod pa'i lcags kyu 'di lan gsum dran par bgyis pa tsam gyis skad cig de nyid kyi mod la bdag rang dang / rang gzhan kyi dang / slob ma dang / bsnyen bkur dang / 'khor dang bcas pa mi gtsang ba yang gtsang bar 'gyur /
translated: disciples, patrons, and retinue will become pure, even if impure.

original: yongs su ma dag pa yang shin tu yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa yang shin tu yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will become completely pure, even if not completely pure.

original: dri ma dang bcas pa yang shin tu dri ma ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dri ma dang bcas pa yang shin tu dri ma ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will become completely stainless, even if stained.

original: zhe sdang dang bcas pa yang zhe sdang dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bcas pa yang zhe sdang dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will become free from anger, even if angry.

original: gti mug dang bcas pa yang gti mug dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gti mug dang bcas pa yang gti mug dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will become free from ignorance, even if ignorant.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa yang 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa yang 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will become free from desire, even if desirous.

original: sgrib pa dang bcas pa yang sgrib pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa dang bcas pa yang sgrib pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will become free from obscurations, even if obscured.

original: bgegs dang bcas pa dang / bdud dang log 'dren gyis yongs su zin pa yang bgegs dang log 'dren dang / bdud la sogs pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bgegs dang bcas pa dang / bdud dang log 'dren gyis yongs su zin pa yang bgegs dang log 'dren dang / bdud la sogs pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are beset by obstacles and those who are seized by demons and false guides will be freed from obstacles, false guides, demons, and so forth.

original: sems kyi sdig pa yang sdig pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems kyi sdig pa yang sdig pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even those with mental negativity will be freed from negativity.

original: thun mong ma yin pa yang thun mong du gyur cing srung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa yang thun mong du gyur cing srung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are not in the common state will become common and be protected.

original: mi smra ba'i brtul zhugs ma mchis pa yang mi smra ba'i brtul zhugs chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi smra ba'i brtul zhugs ma mchis pa yang mi smra ba'i brtul zhugs chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who do not have the practice of silence will come to have the great practice of silence.

original: smyung ba ma bgyis pa yang smyung ba bgyis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smyung ba ma bgyis pa yang smyung ba bgyis par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who have not fasted will have fasted.

original: rig sngags kyi gnas dang yul dang dkyil 'khor thams cad du tshangs par mi spyod pa yang @217b tshangs par spyod pa chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi gnas dang yul dang dkyil 'khor thams cad du tshangs par mi spyod pa yang @217b tshangs par spyod pa chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: In all the places, countries, and maṇḍalas of the knowledge mantras, those who are not celibate will become greatly celibate.

original: tshangs pa'i gnas chen po la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas chen po la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will abide in the great abode of Brahmā.

original: dge pa mi sbyod pa yang dge ba chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge pa mi sbyod pa yang dge ba chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who do not practice virtue will come to have great virtue.

original: chos mi spyod pa yang chos spyod pa chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos mi spyod pa yang chos spyod pa chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even those who do not practice the Dharma will be endowed with great Dharma practice.

original: bsod nams mi bgyid pa yang bsod nams kyi phung ba 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams mi bgyid pa yang bsod nams kyi phung ba 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even those who do not accumulate merit will increase their accumulation of merit.

original: dul ba'i spyod pa ma mchis pa yang dul ba'i spyod pa chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dul ba'i spyod pa ma mchis pa yang dul ba'i spyod pa chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even those who do not have disciplined conduct will be endowed with great disciplined conduct.

original: dkyil 'khor dang / phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags mi mthong ba dang / dam tshig ma mchis pa yang dkyil 'khor dang / phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags mthong ba dang / dam tshig 'tshal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dang / phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags mi mthong ba dang / dam tshig ma mchis pa yang dkyil 'khor dang / phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags mthong ba dang / dam tshig 'tshal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even those who do not see the maṇḍala, mudrā, and secret mantra, and who do not have the samaya, will see the maṇḍala, mudrā, and secret mantra, and will know the samaya.

original: rig sngags kyi gnas dang / 'khor thams cad du sangs rgyas dang / chos mthong bar mi 'tshal ba yang byang chub dang / chos dang / dam tshig dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi gnas dang / 'khor thams cad du sangs rgyas dang / chos mthong bar mi 'tshal ba yang byang chub dang / chos dang / dam tshig dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even those who do not wish to see the Buddha and Dharma in all the abodes and retinues of the vidyās will be endowed with enlightenment, the Dharma, and the samaya.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis ma bsam pa yang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis bsam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis ma bsam pa yang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis bsam par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even those who are not contemplated by all bodhisattvas will be contemplated by all bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa bon gyi yul du ma gyur pa yang byang chub kyi sa bon dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa bon gyi yul du ma gyur pa yang byang chub kyi sa bon dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are not the field for the seed of buddhahood will become endowed with the seed of enlightenment.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi spyod pa dang mi 'bral zhing pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bgyi ba la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi spyod pa dang mi 'bral zhing pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bgyi ba la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not be separated from the practice of the six perfections and will become skilled in perfecting the six perfections.

original: tshul khrims dang mi 'bral zhing ting nge 'dzin rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang mi 'bral zhing ting nge 'dzin rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not be separated from morality and will attain meditative absorption.

original: sbyin pa dang yongs su gtong ba dang mi 'bral zhing @218a *//
analyzed: sbyin pa dang yongs su gtong ba dang mi 'bral zhing @218a *//
translated: They will not be separated from generosity and giving,

original: sbyin pa dang / yongs su gtong ba dang / sbyin pa'i tshogs chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / yongs su gtong ba dang / sbyin pa'i tshogs chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: and will become endowed with generosity, giving, and the great accumulation of generosity.

original: bzod pa dang mi 'bral zhing bzod pa chen po'i bzod pa'i rjes su spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzod pa dang mi 'bral zhing bzod pa chen po'i bzod pa'i rjes su spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not be separated from patience and will practice the patience of great patience.

original: brtson 'grus dang mi 'bral zhing brtson 'grus kyi stobs chen po'i go cha brtan pa bgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang mi 'bral zhing brtson 'grus kyi stobs chen po'i go cha brtan pa bgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not be separated from diligence and will don the armor of the great strength of diligence.

original: bsam gtan dang mi 'bral zhing bsam gan chen po 'thob ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang mi 'bral zhing bsam gan chen po 'thob ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will not be separated from meditative concentration and will attain great meditative concentration.

original: shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pa rgya chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pa rgya chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be endowed with meditative absorption and will become skilled in wisdom and means.

original: rig sngags dang / gsang sngags nyams pa yang gsang sngags dang / phyag rgya yongs su tshang ba dang / cho ga la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig sngags dang / gsang sngags nyams pa yang gsang sngags dang / phyag rgya yongs su tshang ba dang / cho ga la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one’s knowledge mantras and secret mantras are impaired, one’s secret mantras and mudrās will be complete, and one will become skilled in the ritual.

original: dge pa'i bshes gnyen dang bral ba yang dge ba'i bshes gnyen chen po'i lam la rab tu gnas par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge pa'i bshes gnyen dang bral ba yang dge ba'i bshes gnyen chen po'i lam la rab tu gnas par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one is separated from a spiritual friend, one will accomplish the path of a great spiritual friend.

original: 'jigs rten thams cad du snying du sdug pa dang / bla mar bgyis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jigs rten thams cad du snying du sdug pa dang / bla mar bgyis par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be loved and respected by all the worlds.

original: sems can thams cad kyis mchod pa dang / mngon du phyag bgyi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis mchod pa dang / mngon du phyag bgyi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be worshipped and revered by all sentient beings.

original: tshig btsun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig btsun par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will have pure speech.

original: bsam pa yongs su dag par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam pa yongs su dag par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: One’s thoughts will be completely pure.

original: de ltar don yod pa chen po'i cho ga rgya chen po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: de ltar don yod pa chen po'i cho ga rgya chen po 'di dag ni /
translated: In this way, these great, meaningful, extensive rites

original: thams cad du dngos grub don yod pa /
analyzed: thams cad du dngos grub don yod pa /
translated: It is the unfailing means of attaining all accomplishments.

original: mchog tu rnyed par dkar ba /
analyzed: mchog tu rnyed par dkar ba /
translated: It is the supreme and most difficult to obtain.

original: dge ba don yod pa 'di don yod pa'i lcags kyus 'dren par bgyid do //
analyzed: dge ba don yod pa 'di don yod pa'i lcags kyus 'dren par bgyid do //
translated: It is the unfailing virtue that leads with the hook of unfailing means.

original: @218b dngos grub thams cad 'gugs par bgyid do //
analyzed: @218b dngos grub thams cad 'gugs par bgyid do //
translated: It attracts all accomplishments.

original: sgrub pa thams cad 'dren par bgyid do //
analyzed: sgrub pa thams cad 'dren par bgyid do //
translated: It leads to all accomplishments.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ji snyed pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ji snyed pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang /
translated: It leads to all the qualities of the buddhas, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, the fourfold fearlessness, the eightfold noble path, suchness, the very limit of reality,

original: don dam pa dang / stong pa nyid 'dren par bgyid de /
analyzed: don dam pa dang / stong pa nyid 'dren par bgyid de /
translated: the ultimate, and emptiness.

original: don yod pa'i lcags kyu 'dis 'dren par bgyid /
analyzed: don yod pa'i lcags kyu 'dis 'dren par bgyid /
translated: It leads with this hook of unfailing means.

original: yangs par bgyid /
analyzed: yangs par bgyid /
translated: It expands.

original: dngos grub mchog 'dren par bgyid do //
analyzed: dngos grub mchog 'dren par bgyid do //
translated: It leads to the supreme accomplishment.

original: de ltar mthu che ba dang / phan yon che ba dang / yon tan chen por brjod pas bsod nams kyi 'bras bu chen po stsol bar byid do //
analyzed: de ltar mthu che ba dang / phan yon che ba dang / yon tan chen por brjod pas bsod nams kyi 'bras bu chen po stsol bar byid do //
translated: In this way, by describing its great power, great benefits, and great qualities, it bestows the great fruit of merit.

original: de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po dang ldan zhing kun tu gsog par bgyid pas rig sngags kyi rgyal po don yod pa'i lags kyu /
analyzed: de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po dang ldan zhing kun tu gsog par bgyid pas rig sngags kyi rgyal po don yod pa'i lags kyu /
translated: In this way, by possessing and accumulating great roots of virtue, the king of mantras Amoghapaśa

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi snying po ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi snying po ni /
translated: is the essence of noble Avalokiteśvara,🔽the unsurpassed supreme accomplishment.

original: mchog tu grub pa bla na med pa lags so; ;de nas rig sngags 'chang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: mchog tu grub pa bla na med pa lags so; ;de nas rig sngags 'chang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Then, the mantra practitioner, whether a son of good family,

original: rigs kyi bu mo'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo'am /
translated: a daughter of good family,🔽a monk,

original: dge slong nga //🔽dge slong ma'am /🔽dge bsnyen nam /
analyzed: dge slong nga // dge slong ma'am / dge bsnyen nam /
translated: a nun,🔽a male lay practitioner,

original: dge bsnyen ma'am /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma'am /
translated: a female lay practitioner,

original: dge sbyong nga /🔽bram ze'am; rgyal rigs sam /🔽rje'u rigs sam /
analyzed: dge sbyong nga / bram ze'am; rgyal rigs sam / rje'u rigs sam /
translated: an ascetic,🔽a brahmin,🔽a member of the ruling class,

original: dmangs rigs sam /
analyzed: dmangs rigs sam /
translated: a member of the merchant class,🔽a member of the servant class,

original: gzhan su mang rung ba bud med dam /
analyzed: gzhan su mang rung ba bud med dam /
translated: or any other person, whether female

original: skyes ba'am / khye'u'am /
analyzed: skyes ba'am / khye'u'am /
translated: or male, a boy

original: bu mo 'phags ba spyan ras gzigs @219a *//
analyzed: bu mo 'phags ba spyan ras gzigs @219a *//
translated: or a girl, should recite the mantra of noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: dbang phyug rang gi gzugs kyis dgug par 'tshal ba dang / 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bdag nyid kyi rang gi gzugs su mthong bar 'tshal na /
analyzed: dbang phyug rang gi gzugs kyis dgug par 'tshal ba dang / 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bdag nyid kyi rang gi gzugs su mthong bar 'tshal na /
translated: If one wishes to summon Īśvara in his own form, or if one wishes to see the noble Avalokiteśvara in his own form,

original: des cho ga 'di bgyi'o //
analyzed: des cho ga 'di bgyi'o //
translated: one should perform this rite.

original: gtsang ma shin tu khrus bgyis pa /
analyzed: gtsang ma shin tu khrus bgyis pa /
translated: One should be clean and well-bathed,

original: gos gtsang ma bsgos pa /
analyzed: gos gtsang ma bsgos pa /
translated: wearing clean clothes,🔽and with a garland of white flowers, having tied a garland of red silk with the five ambrosias,

original: ba'i rnam lnga'i chus bsang ba'i mchod phyir thogs btags pas ras dmar po'i skud pa'i mchod phyir thogs kha dog bzang po gnas bdun du yongs su gzung ste /
analyzed: ba'i rnam lnga'i chus bsang ba'i mchod phyir thogs btags pas ras dmar po'i skud pa'i mchod phyir thogs kha dog bzang po gnas bdun du yongs su gzung ste /
translated: one should bind it to the seven places:

original: mtshog ma dang / spyi gtsug bcing ba dang / gnas gsum pa dpung pa gnyis su bcing pa /
analyzed: mtshog ma dang / spyi gtsug bcing ba dang / gnas gsum pa dpung pa gnyis su bcing pa /
translated: on the head, on the crown, and on the two shoulders,🔽on the two upper arms, and then around the waist.

original: lag ngar gnyis su bcing ba dang / de nas rked par bcings pa sa phyogs gtsang mar 'dug nas sam /
analyzed: lag ngar gnyis su bcing ba dang / de nas rked par bcings pa sa phyogs gtsang mar 'dug nas sam /
translated: Having sat in a clean place,🔽or in any other suitable secluded place free from disturbance,

original: gnas gzhan gang yang rung ba dben zhing 'khrugs pa ma mchis pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi stegs gru bzhi pa shin tu rnam par mdzes pa /
analyzed: gnas gzhan gang yang rung ba dben zhing 'khrugs pa ma mchis pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi stegs gru bzhi pa shin tu rnam par mdzes pa /
translated: on a square altar of the maṇḍala, very beautiful,

original: gru bzhi'i tshad tsam la 'phang sor brgyad kyi tshad tsam kun nas zlum po legs par byugs pa shin tu 'jam par bgyi'o //
analyzed: gru bzhi'i tshad tsam la 'phang sor brgyad kyi tshad tsam kun nas zlum po legs par byugs pa shin tu 'jam par bgyi'o //
translated: The size of the mandala should be four cubits, and the height should be eight finger-widths. It should be well anointed and very smooth.

original: de nas tshon sna tshogs kyi skud bas rnam par mdzes par thig gdab cing tshon rtsi sna tshogs kyis bri bar bgyi'o; ;snying po'i dkyil 'khor ni /
analyzed: de nas tshon sna tshogs kyi skud bas rnam par mdzes par thig gdab cing tshon rtsi sna tshogs kyis bri bar bgyi'o; ;snying po'i dkyil 'khor ni /
translated: Then, having made it beautiful with multicolored cords and various colors, one should draw it. The central mandala

original: khru gang tsam gyi tshad la gru bzhi pa /
analyzed: khru gang tsam gyi tshad la gru bzhi pa /
translated: should be one cubit in size and square,

original: rnam par phye ba /
analyzed: rnam par phye ba /
translated: divided,

original: shin tu mdzes pa /
analyzed: shin tu mdzes pa /
translated: very beautiful,

original: gru bzhi kun kha khyer gyi rnam pa can bgyi'o //
analyzed: gru bzhi kun kha khyer gyi rnam pa can bgyi'o //
translated: and have a border all around.

original: dbus su @219b padma bgyi'o //
analyzed: dbus su @219b padma bgyi'o //
translated: In the center, one should make a lotus,

original: 'dab ma brgya rtsa brgyad pa /
analyzed: 'dab ma brgya rtsa brgyad pa /
translated: with one hundred and eight petals.

original: 'dab ma thams cad la lcags kyu bri zhing dbus kyi snying po ge sar dang bcas pa rin po che sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma thams cad la lcags kyu bri zhing dbus kyi snying po ge sar dang bcas pa rin po che sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa bgyi'o //
translated: On all the petals, one should draw hooks. In the center, the pericarp should be adorned with various jewels.

original: 'od kyi phreng ba zlum po tshon rtsi sna tshogs kyis rnam par mdzes par bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'od kyi phreng ba zlum po tshon rtsi sna tshogs kyis rnam par mdzes par bgyi'o //
translated: One should make it beautiful with a circular garland of light and various colors.

original: snying po'i dkyil 'khor gyi gra bzhir lcags kyu dang zhags pa kun nas zlum po yang bgyi'o //
analyzed: snying po'i dkyil 'khor gyi gra bzhir lcags kyu dang zhags pa kun nas zlum po yang bgyi'o //
translated: In the four corners of the mandala of the essence, one should also make iron hooks and lassos completely round.

original: phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor kun tu mtshan ma'i phyag rgya sna tshogs kyang bri bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor kun tu mtshan ma'i phyag rgya sna tshogs kyang bri bar bgyi'o //
translated: In the outer mandala, one should also draw various symbolic mudras.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi gra bzhir rnam par phye bar rgyal po chen po bzhi 'bar ba'i nang na go cha bgos pa /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi gra bzhir rnam par phye bar rgyal po chen po bzhi 'bar ba'i nang na go cha bgos pa /
translated: In the four corners of the mandala, one should draw the four great kings, clad in armor within a blazing fire,

original: drag shul gyi gzugs can 'jigs par bgyid pa bri'o //
analyzed: drag shul gyi gzugs can 'jigs par bgyid pa bri'o //
translated: with wrathful forms, causing fear.

original: sgo bzhi rnam par phye bar yang dkyil 'khor gyi lha bri bar bgyi ste /
analyzed: sgo bzhi rnam par phye bar yang dkyil 'khor gyi lha bri bar bgyi ste /
translated: In the four open doors, one should also draw the deities of the mandala.

original: shar phyogs kyi sgor rdo rje 'chang zhi ba'i gzugs can bzhin 'dzum pa /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi sgor rdo rje 'chang zhi ba'i gzugs can bzhin 'dzum pa /
translated: At the eastern door, one should draw Vajradhara, with a peaceful form, smiling,

original: rdo rje 'gying bag can du 'dzin pa /
analyzed: rdo rje 'gying bag can du 'dzin pa /
translated: holding a vajra with a proud bearing,

original: ri rab kyi steng na 'bar ba'i nang na mchis pa bri'o //
analyzed: ri rab kyi steng na 'bar ba'i nang na mchis pa bri'o //
translated: standing on Mount Meru, within a blazing fire.

original: lho phyogs kyi sgor khro bo'i rgyal po drag shul gyi gzugs can 'jigs par bgyid pa /
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi sgor khro bo'i rgyal po drag shul gyi gzugs can 'jigs par bgyid pa /
translated: At the southern door, one should draw the wrathful king, with a form of wrath, causing fear,

original: padma dang zhags pa thogs pa /
analyzed: padma dang zhags pa thogs pa /
translated: holding a lotus and a noose,

original: me tog kha phye ba'i steng na 'bar ba'i nang na mchis pa'o //
analyzed: me tog kha phye ba'i steng na 'bar ba'i nang na mchis pa'o //
translated: He is seated on an open lotus, in the middle of a blazing fire.

original: nub phyogs kyi sgor dbang po rdo rje thogs pa /
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi sgor dbang po rdo rje thogs pa /
translated: At the western gate, one should draw Indra, holding a vajra,

original: mig gsum pa ri'i steng na 'bar ba'i nang na mchis pa bri'o //
analyzed: mig gsum pa ri'i steng na 'bar ba'i nang na mchis pa bri'o //
translated: with three eyes, seated on a mountain, in the middle of a blazing fire.

original: byang phyogs kyi sgor don yod pa'i zhags pa gdong khro gnyer can /
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi sgor don yod pa'i zhags pa gdong khro gnyer can /
translated: At the northern gate, one should draw Amoghapāśa, with a frowning face,

original: padma dang zhags pa thogs pa /
analyzed: padma dang zhags pa thogs pa /
translated: holding a lotus and a noose,

original: padma'i 'dab ma'i steng na 'bar ba'i @220a *//
analyzed: padma'i 'dab ma'i steng na 'bar ba'i @220a *//
translated: seated on a lotus leaf, in the middle of a blazing fire,

original: nang na lcags kyu dang lhan cig mchis pa bri'o //
analyzed: nang na lcags kyu dang lhan cig mchis pa bri'o //
translated: together with a hook.

original: dkyil 'khor khor khor yug tu gos dang / ba dan dang / mnga' dang / rgyal mtshan kun gyis brgyar par bgyi'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor khor khor yug tu gos dang / ba dan dang / mnga' dang / rgyal mtshan kun gyis brgyar par bgyi'o //
translated: All around the maṇḍala, one should hang cloths, banners, pennants, and victory banners.

original: tshon sna lnga'i skud pas khor khor yug tu dkri bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: tshon sna lnga'i skud pas khor khor yug tu dkri bar bgyi'o //
translated: One should tie it all around with five-colored cords.

original: gtor ma thams cad dkar po gzhag go /
analyzed: gtor ma thams cad dkar po gzhag go /
translated: All the bali offerings should be placed on white [surfaces].

original: dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol kun tu dngul dang / gser gyi snod rnam pa sna tshogs pa gzhag go /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol kun tu dngul dang / gser gyi snod rnam pa sna tshogs pa gzhag go /
translated: Outside the maṇḍala, one should place various silver and golden vessels.

original: snying po'i dkyil 'khor khor khor yug tu dngul gyi snod bkang ba bzhi dang / 'o mas bkang ba zhi dang / mchod yon dang / zhabs bsil ba'i snod bzhi dang / dri'i snod bzhi dang / dris bkang ba'i snod bzhi dang / dngul gyi phog phor aa ga ru dang /🔽tsandan dang / du ru ka'i bdug spos bsregs pa bzhi gzhag go /
analyzed: snying po'i dkyil 'khor khor khor yug tu dngul gyi snod bkang ba bzhi dang / 'o mas bkang ba zhi dang / mchod yon dang / zhabs bsil ba'i snod bzhi dang / dri'i snod bzhi dang / dris bkang ba'i snod bzhi dang / dngul gyi phog phor aa ga ru dang / tsandan dang / du ru ka'i bdug spos bsregs pa bzhi gzhag go /
translated: In the center of the maṇḍala, all around, one should place four silver bowls filled with milk, water, drinking water, and washing water, four perfume bowls, four bowls filled with perfume, and four silver censers burning aloeswood, sandalwood, and durvā grass.

original: phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor kho ra khor yug tu sa las byas pa'i snod bkang ba dang / gtor ma'i snod bum pa yongs su bkang ba drug cu rtsa bzhi dang / bdug pa sna tshogs bsregs pa'i pog phor brgyad 'jigs pa med par gzhag par bgyi'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor kho ra khor yug tu sa las byas pa'i snod bkang ba dang / gtor ma'i snod bum pa yongs su bkang ba drug cu rtsa bzhi dang / bdug pa sna tshogs bsregs pa'i pog phor brgyad 'jigs pa med par gzhag par bgyi'o //
translated: Outside the maṇḍala, all around, one should place sixty-four earthenware bowls filled with earth and bali bowls, completely full, and eight censers burning various incenses.

original: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis tshes bcu bzhi nas zla ba nya ches bco lnga'i bar gyi nyin zhag gcig smyung ba bgyis pas /
analyzed: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis tshes bcu bzhi nas zla ba nya ches bco lnga'i bar gyi nyin zhag gcig smyung ba bgyis pas /
translated: Then, the vidyādhara should fast for one day and one night, from the fourteenth to the fifteenth of the waxing moon.

original: 'bras yos dang / yungs kar la don yod pa'i rgyal po'i snying pos lan brgya rtsa brgyad yongs su bzlas pas @220b dkyil 'khor du gtor bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'bras yos dang / yungs kar la don yod pa'i rgyal po'i snying pos lan brgya rtsa brgyad yongs su bzlas pas @220b dkyil 'khor du gtor bar bgyi'o //
translated: One should scatter parched grain and white mustard seeds in the maṇḍala, having enchanted them one hundred and eight times with the essence mantra of Amoghapāśa.

original: yungs kar dang / dri chab la khro bo'i rgyal pos lan brgya rtsa brgyad yongs su bzlas pas dkyil 'khor kun tu gtor zhing dkyil 'khor dbang bskur bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: yungs kar dang / dri chab la khro bo'i rgyal pos lan brgya rtsa brgyad yongs su bzlas pas dkyil 'khor kun tu gtor zhing dkyil 'khor dbang bskur bar bgyi'o //
translated: One should scatter white mustard seeds and perfume in the maṇḍala, having enchanted them one hundred and eight times with the essence mantra of Krodharāja, and consecrate the maṇḍala.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du mar me drug cu rtsa bzhi sbar bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du mar me drug cu rtsa bzhi sbar bar bgyi'o //
translated: Outside the maṇḍala, one should light sixty-four lamps.

original: me tog ji snyed pa mang po bkram zhing kho ra khor yug tu phreng ba gzhag par bgyi'o //
analyzed: me tog ji snyed pa mang po bkram zhing kho ra khor yug tu phreng ba gzhag par bgyi'o //
translated: One should scatter as many flowers as one can afford and place garlands all around.

original: rig sngags 'chang gis don yod pa'i lcags kyus yungs kar la lan nyi shu rtsa gcig yongs su bzlas pas dkyil 'khor kun dang / phyogs bzhi dang / steng dang / 'og tu gtor na /
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang gis don yod pa'i lcags kyus yungs kar la lan nyi shu rtsa gcig yongs su bzlas pas dkyil 'khor kun dang / phyogs bzhi dang / steng dang / 'og tu gtor na /
translated: The vidyādhara should scatter white mustard seeds in the maṇḍala, having enchanted them twenty-one times with Amoghavajra, in the four directions, above, and below.

original: dkyil 'khor bcing ba bgyis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bcing ba bgyis par 'gyur ro //
translated: The maṇḍala will be bound.

original: phyogs bcing ba dang / spyi gtsug bcing ba dang / bdag srung ba bgyis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs bcing ba dang / spyi gtsug bcing ba dang / bdag srung ba bgyis par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will bind the directions, bind the crown of the head, and protect oneself.

original: bgegs dang / log 'dren dang / 'byung po dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / bdud la sogs pa thams cad bcings par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bgegs dang / log 'dren dang / 'byung po dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / bdud la sogs pa thams cad bcings par 'gyur ro //
translated: All obstacles, evil forces, spirits, yakṣas, rākṣasas, māras, and so forth will be bound.

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po gang dag mthong ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi 'dzin pa de thams cad bkug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po gang dag mthong ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi 'dzin pa de thams cad bkug par 'gyur ro //
translated: All gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas who see and uphold the bases of the Tathāgata’s training will be summoned.

original: dkyil 'khor kun nas bsrung ba'i slad du gshin rje dang / chu lha dang / gzhon nu dang / ku be ra dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi dpung dang / 'khor dang bcas pa @221a *//
analyzed: dkyil 'khor kun nas bsrung ba'i slad du gshin rje dang / chu lha dang / gzhon nu dang / ku be ra dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi dpung dang / 'khor dang bcas pa @221a *//
translated: For the sake of protecting the maṇḍala, Yama, Varuṇa, Kumāra, Kubera, and the four great kings, together with their armies and retinues,

original: lcags kyu dang / zhags pas bkug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lcags kyu dang / zhags pas bkug par 'gyur te /
translated: will be summoned with hooks and nooses.

original: dkyil 'khor kun nas srung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba ba bgyid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor kun nas srung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba ba bgyid par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will guard, protect, and conceal the maṇḍala from all sides.

original: 'og gi sa'i lha mo sa'i 'og na gnas pa rnams dang lhan cig dkyil 'khor bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba ba'i slad du mchis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'og gi sa'i lha mo sa'i 'og na gnas pa rnams dang lhan cig dkyil 'khor bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba ba'i slad du mchis par 'gyur ro //
translated: The earth goddess who dwells below the ground will also come to guard, protect, and conceal the maṇḍala together with those who dwell below the ground.

original: steng nas nam mkha' la tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug chen po dang / brgya byin dang / mtshan mo'i lha dang / nyi ma dang / zla ba rgyu skar bcas par bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba ba bgyis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: steng nas nam mkha' la tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug chen po dang / brgya byin dang / mtshan mo'i lha dang / nyi ma dang / zla ba rgyu skar bcas par bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba ba bgyis par 'gyur ro //
translated: Above, Brahmā, Viṣṇu, Maheśvara, Śakra, the night goddess, the sun, the moon, and the stars will guard, protect, and conceal the maṇḍala.

original: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis phyag bgyi ba'i las bgyi ste /
analyzed: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis phyag bgyi ba'i las bgyi ste /
translated: Then the knowledge-holder should perform the ritual of prostration.

original: rig sngags 'chang gis rtsva ku sha'i steng du shar phyogs kyi sgor dkyil 'khor la mngon du phyogs par skyil mo krung bcas te mchis la gzhan mi smra bar don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po lan brgya rtsa brgyad yongs su bzlas pa bgyis la /
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang gis rtsva ku sha'i steng du shar phyogs kyi sgor dkyil 'khor la mngon du phyogs par skyil mo krung bcas te mchis la gzhan mi smra bar don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po lan brgya rtsa brgyad yongs su bzlas pa bgyis la /
translated: The vidyādhara should sit cross-legged on kuśa grass in the eastern door of the maṇḍala facing the maṇḍala, and without speaking to anyone else, he should recite the Amoghapāśa essence mantra one hundred and eight times.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi snying por 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bzhag par bgyi zhing me tog re re la bzlas brjod bgyis pas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi mdun du dor bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi snying por 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bzhag par bgyi zhing me tog re re la bzlas brjod bgyis pas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi mdun du dor bar bgyi'o //
translated: He should place Noble Avalokiteśvara in the center of the maṇḍala and cast the flowers, each one having been recited over, in front of Noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: de nas khro bo'i rgyal pos yungs kar gyi 'bru re re la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod bgyis pas gtor bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: de nas khro bo'i rgyal pos yungs kar gyi 'bru re re la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod bgyis pas gtor bar bgyi'o //
translated: Then the king of wrathful ones should scatter mustard seeds, each one having been recited over one hundred and eight times.

original: de nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs @221b dbang phyug gi snying po don yod pa'i zhags pa'i lcags kyus bzlas brjod stong rtsa brgyad bgyis pas dbul bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: de nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs @221b dbang phyug gi snying po don yod pa'i zhags pa'i lcags kyus bzlas brjod stong rtsa brgyad bgyis pas dbul bar bgyi'o //
translated: Then, with the heart-mantra of noble Avalokiteśvara, the invincible lasso hook, one should recite one thousand and eight times and make offerings to the poor.

original: ril bu re re la bzlas brjod bgyis pa'i bdug spos dbul bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: ril bu re re la bzlas brjod bgyis pa'i bdug spos dbul bar bgyi'o //
translated: One should offer incense with each pill, reciting the mantra.

original: yungs kar re re la bzlas brjod bgyis la snying po'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du dor bar bgyi'o //🔽stong rtsa brgyad rdzogs pa dang / thun tha ma'i nam nangs kar gya nom pa /
analyzed: yungs kar re re la bzlas brjod bgyis la snying po'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du dor bar bgyi'o // stong rtsa brgyad rdzogs pa dang / thun tha ma'i nam nangs kar gya nom pa /
translated: One should cast mustard seeds with each recitation of the mantra into the mandala of the heart.🔽When one has completed one thousand and eight, at dawn of the last watch, there will be a delightful,

original: yid du 'ong zhing dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bar bgyid par sa g-yo bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: yid du 'ong zhing dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bar bgyid par sa g-yo bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: pleasing, and joyful earthquake.

original: sgra mnyen pa dang / snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / yid du 'ong ba zab mo zab mo dang / ka la ping+ka dang / mi'am ci'i sgra dbyangs lta bu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra mnyen pa dang / snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / yid du 'ong ba zab mo zab mo dang / ka la ping+ka dang / mi'am ci'i sgra dbyangs lta bu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: There will be a deep, deep, pleasant, melodious, delightful, profound sound, like the voice of a kalaviṅka or a kinnara.

original: rig sngags 'chang gi sems brtan por bgyi zhing mchog tu dga' bar yid la bgyid pas bzlas brjod bgyi'o //
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang gi sems brtan por bgyi zhing mchog tu dga' bar yid la bgyid pas bzlas brjod bgyi'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra with a firm mind of a knowledge-holder, keeping in mind supreme joy.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi snying po nas 'od zer rnam pa sna tshogs mang po 'byung zhing phyogs dang / phyogs mtshams kun tu mchi zhing snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi snying po nas 'od zer rnam pa sna tshogs mang po 'byung zhing phyogs dang / phyogs mtshams kun tu mchi zhing snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, from the center of the maṇḍala, various kinds of light rays emerge and shine in all directions and the intermediate directions.

original: nam mkha'i dkyil na sprin brtsegs pa'i phung po bzhin du 'od zer gyi gdugs su gyur nas gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil na sprin brtsegs pa'i phung po bzhin du 'od zer gyi gdugs su gyur nas gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: They become a canopy of light rays and remain like a mass of piled-up clouds in the center of the sky.

original: de nas sngon ma byung ba'i dri zhim po rmad du byung ba 'byung bar 'gyur zhing lha'i tsandan dang / go shirsha'i tsandan dang / tsandan sbrul gyi snying po dang / ga pur dang / gla rtsi'i dri 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas sngon ma byung ba'i dri zhim po rmad du byung ba 'byung bar 'gyur zhing lha'i tsandan dang / go shirsha'i tsandan dang / tsandan sbrul gyi snying po dang / ga pur dang / gla rtsi'i dri 'byung ste /
translated: Then, an unprecedented, marvelous, sweet fragrance arises, the fragrance of divine sandalwood, gośīrṣa sandalwood, uragasāra sandalwood, camphor, and musk.

original: dpag tshad brgya khor khor yug tu dri gnas par @222a *//
analyzed: dpag tshad brgya khor khor yug tu dri gnas par @222a *//
translated: The fragrance remains for a hundred leagues all around.

original: 'gyur ro // lha rdzas kyi bdug spos kyi dri zhim po sngon ma byung ba rmad du byung ba bee d'urya sngon po'i sprin brtsegs pa lta bu'i bdug spos kyi sprin nam mkha'i dkyil na gnas par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // lha rdzas kyi bdug spos kyi dri zhim po sngon ma byung ba rmad du byung ba bee d'urya sngon po'i sprin brtsegs pa lta bu'i bdug spos kyi sprin nam mkha'i dkyil na gnas par yang 'gyur te /
translated: The sky will be filled with clouds of incense, like the piled-up clouds of blue beryl, with the wonderful, previously unknown sweet scent of divine incense.

original: phyogs bcu kun tu bdug spos kyi dri rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs bcu kun tu bdug spos kyi dri rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The scent of incense will spread throughout the ten directions.

original: de nas snying po'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bdag nyid kyi rang gi gzugs kyis 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas snying po'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bdag nyid kyi rang gi gzugs kyis 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, from the center of the essential maṇḍala, Noble Avalokiteśvara will appear in his own form.

original: tshangs pa bzang po'i cha lugs can /
analyzed: tshangs pa bzang po'i cha lugs can /
translated: He will have the appearance of a good Brahmā,

original: ral pa'i thor tshugs kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: ral pa'i thor tshugs kyis brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with a topknot,

original: don yod pa'i zhags pa'i gzugs su lag pa bzhi pa /
analyzed: don yod pa'i zhags pa'i gzugs su lag pa bzhi pa /
translated: in the form of Amoghapāśa, with four arms,

original: padma dang zhags pa thogs pa /
analyzed: padma dang zhags pa thogs pa /
translated: holding a lotus and a noose,

original: rgyal ba 'od dpag tu med pa'i dbu rgyan can /
analyzed: rgyal ba 'od dpag tu med pa'i dbu rgyan can /
translated: with the crown of the victorious Amitābha,

original: dbu rgyan zla ba tshes pas brgyan pa /
analyzed: dbu rgyan zla ba tshes pas brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with the crescent moon on his crown,

original: mdung rtse gsum pa thogs shing dbugs 'byin pa /
analyzed: mdung rtse gsum pa thogs shing dbugs 'byin pa /
translated: holding a trident and sighing.

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: Adorned with all ornaments,

original: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos brgyan pa /
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with the major and minor marks,

original: rang gi 'od dang gzi brjid kyis shin tu 'bar ba /
analyzed: rang gi 'od dang gzi brjid kyis shin tu 'bar ba /
translated: blazing with his own radiance and splendor,

original: bzhin 'dzum zhing nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i 'od zer gyi snang ba dang ldan pa /
analyzed: bzhin 'dzum zhing nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i 'od zer gyi snang ba dang ldan pa /
translated: smiling, with a radiance surpassing a thousand suns,

original: khru brgyad tsam gyis lus bzang pos dkyil 'khor gyi snying po'i padma'i stan las langs te /
analyzed: khru brgyad tsam gyis lus bzang pos dkyil 'khor gyi snying po'i padma'i stan las langs te /
translated: with a body eight cubits tall, he rose from the lotus seat in the center of the maṇḍala,🔽and while remaining in the sky, with a peaceful form, his mind filled with loving kindness and great compassion, he looked throughout the maṇḍala and contemplated the ten directions.

original: nam mkha' la mchis nas zhi ba'i gzugs can byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje chen po yid la bgyis pas dkyil 'khor kun tu lta zhing phyogs bcur rtog par bgyid @222b ; ;de nas rig sngags 'chang la legs so zhes bya ba'i sgra 'byung ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' la mchis nas zhi ba'i gzugs can byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje chen po yid la bgyis pas dkyil 'khor kun tu lta zhing phyogs bcur rtog par bgyid @222b ; ;de nas rig sngags 'chang la legs so zhes bya ba'i sgra 'byung ste /
translated: Then a voice saying “Excellent!” was heard:

original: rig sngags 'chang chen po legs so legs so //
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang chen po legs so legs so //
translated: “Excellent, excellent, great vidyādhara!

original: lag pa g-yas pa brkyang ba'i lag mthil shin tu bzang po 'od zer bye ba brgya stong phrag stong gis legs par brgyan pa'i lag pa rig sngags 'chang gi spyi bor 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa brkyang ba'i lag mthil shin tu bzang po 'od zer bye ba brgya stong phrag stong gis legs par brgyan pa'i lag pa rig sngags 'chang gi spyi bor 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The palm of his right hand, which is very beautiful, is adorned with ten thousand million light rays. He places his hand on the head of the knowledge-mantra bearer.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis lag pa spyi bor bzhag ma thag tu de nas rig sngags 'chang de nam mkha' la mchis te /
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis lag pa spyi bor bzhag ma thag tu de nas rig sngags 'chang de nam mkha' la mchis te /
translated: As soon as Noble Avalokiteśvara places his hand on the head of the knowledge-mantra bearer, he will then rise up into the sky.

original: don yod pa'i zhags pa dang / lcags kyu rgya chen po 'od zer snang ba bkod pa rnam par 'phrul pa zhes bya ba sgyu ma lta bu'i shugs kyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'thob ste /
analyzed: don yod pa'i zhags pa dang / lcags kyu rgya chen po 'od zer snang ba bkod pa rnam par 'phrul pa zhes bya ba sgyu ma lta bu'i shugs kyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'thob ste /
translated: He will attain the meditative absorption called the magical emanation of the array of light rays of the great lasso and hook, and the magical emanation of the magical illusion-like power called the maṇḍala.

original: ting nge 'dzin gzhan yang bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi bye ma snyed 'thob bo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gzhan yang bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi bye ma snyed 'thob bo //
translated: He will attain another hundred thousand quintillion meditative absorptions.

original: kun tu don yod par lta ba nor bu'i snying po rgya chen por grags pa don yod pa'i lcags kyu'i gzungs /
analyzed: kun tu don yod par lta ba nor bu'i snying po rgya chen por grags pa don yod pa'i lcags kyu'i gzungs /
translated: He will attain the dhāraṇī called the great jewel essence of the view of omnipresence, the inexhaustible lasso.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi snying po'i gzungs 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi snying po'i gzungs 'thob par 'gyur te /

original: gang gis gzungs thob pa'i mod la don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po'i phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags rim par phye ba'i cho ga zhib mo byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis phyag bgyis pa /
analyzed: gang gis gzungs thob pa'i mod la don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po'i phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags rim par phye ba'i cho ga zhib mo byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis phyag bgyis pa /
translated: As soon as one attains the dhāraṇī, the essence of Amoghapaśa, the mudrā, and the detailed ritual of the mantra will be recited, and all bodhisattvas will pay homage.

original: rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor mtha' dag rdzogs par kha ton nyid du gnas so //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor mtha' dag rdzogs par kha ton nyid du gnas so //
translated: The entire maṇḍala of liberation will be perfected.

original: gzhan yang padma rgya chen po'i dkyil @223a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang padma rgya chen po'i dkyil @223a *//
translated: Moreover, the entire maṇḍala of the great lotus

original: 'khor mtha' dag dang / rdo rje'i rigs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang / nor bu'i rigs dang / glang po che'i rigs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs kyi dam tshig dang / gsang ba chen po'i snying po dang /
analyzed: 'khor mtha' dag dang / rdo rje'i rigs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang / nor bu'i rigs dang / glang po che'i rigs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs kyi dam tshig dang / gsang ba chen po'i snying po dang /
translated: and the commitments of the vajra family, the tathāgata family, the jewel family, the elephant family, and the family of all tathāgatas, the essence of the great secret,

analyzed: phyag rgya dang bcas pa'i gsang sngags rim par phye ba gsang ba dang / cho ga zhib mo'i rnam pa thams cad kha ton nyid du gnas so //
translated: The secret is the division of the mantras with the mudras, and all the aspects of the detailed rites remain as recitations.

original: rig sngags 'chang gi 'khor los bsgyur ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma dgu bcu rtsa gnyis pa rnams kyi gtso bo dang / mchog dang / rig sngags 'chang gi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang gi 'khor los bsgyur ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma dgu bcu rtsa gnyis pa rnams kyi gtso bo dang / mchog dang / rig sngags 'chang gi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be the chief and supreme among the vidyādhara cakravartins, as numerous as the grains of sand in ninety-two Ganges Rivers, of the vidyādhara cakravartins.

original: de nas rig sngags 'chang 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis rig sngags 'chang de la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas rig sngags 'chang 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis rig sngags 'chang de la smras pa /
translated: Then the vidyādhara Avalokiteśvara said to that vidyādhara:

original: rig sngags 'chang /
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang /
translated: “Vidyādhara,

original: ji ltar yid la byed pa dang / bsam pa smros shig dang / mchog de thams cad rjes su sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yid la byed pa dang / bsam pa smros shig dang / mchog de thams cad rjes su sbyin par bya'o //
translated: speak of the mental activity and thoughts, and I will give you all those supreme things.”

original: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis ji ltar yid la bsam pa dang / mchog mngon par 'dod pa de thams cad smra zhing mchog yid la re ba thams cad sbyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis ji ltar yid la bsam pa dang / mchog mngon par 'dod pa de thams cad smra zhing mchog yid la re ba thams cad sbyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, the vidyādhara will speak whatever is desired in the mind, and all that is wished for will be granted.

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dgos pa sna tshogs da ltar byung ba rnams smra zhing 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar @223b byung ba smra'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dgos pa sna tshogs da ltar byung ba rnams smra zhing 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar @223b byung ba smra'o //
translated: Moreover, he will speak various mundane and supramundane needs that have arisen, and he will speak of the past, future, and present.

original: lo legs pa dang / lo nyes pa dang / bde ba dang / nad dang / 'jigs ba dang / lhag par 'jigs pa dang / pha rol gyi dmag tshogs dang / rang gi dmag tshogs dang / phyir rgol ba dang / dgra bo dang /
analyzed: lo legs pa dang / lo nyes pa dang / bde ba dang / nad dang / 'jigs ba dang / lhag par 'jigs pa dang / pha rol gyi dmag tshogs dang / rang gi dmag tshogs dang / phyir rgol ba dang / dgra bo dang /
translated: He will speak of good harvests, bad harvests, happiness, sickness, fear, great fear, foreign armies, one's own armies, adversaries, enemies,

original: yams kyi nad dang / mi ngas dang / gnod pa dang / nad 'go ba dang / 'tshe ba dang / gza' 'thab pa dang / 'thab mo dang / rtsod pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / 'gyed pa dang / g-yul 'gyed pa dang /
analyzed: yams kyi nad dang / mi ngas dang / gnod pa dang / nad 'go ba dang / 'tshe ba dang / gza' 'thab pa dang / 'thab mo dang / rtsod pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / 'gyed pa dang / g-yul 'gyed pa dang /
translated: epidemics, famines, harm, illnesses, afflictions, quarrels, disputes, arguments, fights, battles,

original: char ches pa dang / char dkon pa dang / dus ma yin pa'i char dang / tshe ring ba dang / tshe thung ba dang / tshe yongs su zad pa dang / dus ma yin par 'chi ba dang / 'byor pa dang / rgud pa dang /
analyzed: char ches pa dang / char dkon pa dang / dus ma yin pa'i char dang / tshe ring ba dang / tshe thung ba dang / tshe yongs su zad pa dang / dus ma yin par 'chi ba dang / 'byor pa dang / rgud pa dang /
translated: excess rain, drought, untimely rain, long life, short life, the exhaustion of life, untimely death, prosperity, decline,

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / 'grub pa dang / mi 'grub pa dang / bgegs dang / bgegs med pa dang / bdud kyi bar chad dang / 'bru 'phel ba dang / nor 'phel ba dang /
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / 'grub pa dang / mi 'grub pa dang / bgegs dang / bgegs med pa dang / bdud kyi bar chad dang / 'bru 'phel ba dang / nor 'phel ba dang /
translated: virtue, non-virtue, arising, ceasing, accomplishment, non-accomplishment, obstacles, non-obstacles, Māra’s obstructions, the increase of grain, the increase of wealth,

original: nad mang ba dang / nad dang bral bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de thams cad byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rig sngags 'chang la smra bar 'gyur ro //🔽sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / lha ma yin gyi 'jig rten dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / 'byung po dang / sha za dang / grul bum dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen @224a *//
analyzed: nad mang ba dang / nad dang bral bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de thams cad byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rig sngags 'chang la smra bar 'gyur ro // sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / lha ma yin gyi 'jig rten dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / 'byung po dang / sha za dang / grul bum dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen @224a *//
translated: All of them will speak to the bodhisattva mahāsattva noble Avalokiteśvara, the reciter of the vidyā, about the many illnesses and the freedom from illness.

original: po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dang / dud 'gro'i skyes gnas pa ri dvags dang / bya'i skye ba dang / 'chi ba de thams cad phyin ci ma log par smra zhes de dag gi thabs thams cad kyang ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dang / dud 'gro'i skyes gnas pa ri dvags dang / bya'i skye ba dang / 'chi ba de thams cad phyin ci ma log par smra zhes de dag gi thabs thams cad kyang ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The worlds of hell beings, pretas, asuras, yakṣas, rākṣasas, bhūtas, piśācas, kumbhāṇḍas, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, humans, non-humans, and animals—the deer, birds, and those born as hell beings—all of them will speak without error. They will also reveal all their methods.”

original: lhar skye ba dang / klur skye ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing skye ba dang / rgyal po nyid dang / bud med dang / skyes pa nyid dang / bu rnyed pa de thams cad smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhar skye ba dang / klur skye ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing skye ba dang / rgyal po nyid dang / bud med dang / skyes pa nyid dang / bu rnyed pa de thams cad smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will speak of all those who will be born as gods, nāgas, and in the buddhafields, and of those who will become kings, women, men, and obtain sons.

original: bram ze'i rigs su skye ba dang / rgyal rigs su skye ba dang / khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bur skye ba de thams cad smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bram ze'i rigs su skye ba dang / rgyal rigs su skye ba dang / khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bur skye ba de thams cad smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will speak of all those who will be born in the brahmin caste, the kṣatriya caste, and the householder caste that is like a great sāla tree.

original: gzhan yang rigs mthon po dang / dma' ba dang / smad pa'i rigs su skye ba sna tshogs de dag thams cad ston cing smra la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs mthon po dang / dma' ba dang / smad pa'i rigs su skye ba sna tshogs de dag thams cad ston cing smra la /
translated: Moreover, he will reveal all those various births in high and low castes, and in despised castes.

original: thabs kyang bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thabs kyang bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will also reveal the means.

original: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis ji ltar bsam pa'i don de thams cad 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang mngon sum du smra zhing thams cad gtam zer ro //

original: yul gyi bdag po nyid dang / chu klung chen po rgal ba dang / dug bza' ba dang / gsang sngags sna tshogs sgrub pa'i dngos grub pa dang / 'jigs pa chen po brgyad zhi bar bya ba dang / dgug pa dang / dran pa de thams cad stsol bar bgyid do //
analyzed: yul gyi bdag po nyid dang / chu klung chen po rgal ba dang / dug bza' ba dang / gsang sngags sna tshogs sgrub pa'i dngos grub pa dang / 'jigs pa chen po brgyad zhi bar bya ba dang / dgug pa dang / dran pa de thams cad stsol bar bgyid do //
translated: pacifying the eight great fears,🔽summoning,🔽and all those who are to be remembered.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar yid la bgyid pa de thams cad stsol bar bgyid do //
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar yid la bgyid pa de thams cad stsol bar bgyid do //
translated: Moreover, he will grant all that is desired.

original: de dag thams cad kyi dgos pa thams cad don yod pa'i zhags pa'i lcags kyu'i snying pos 'dren cing /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi dgos pa thams cad don yod pa'i zhags pa'i lcags kyu'i snying pos 'dren cing /
translated: The heart essence of Amogha-pāśa's hook will draw forth all the needs of all of them.

original: don yod pa'i zhags pas bcings par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don yod pa'i zhags pas bcings par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be bound by Amogha-pāśa.

original: bsams pa dang / don du gnyer ba dang / yid la re ba'i dgos pa de thams cad shin tu ring po nas kyang don yod pa'i zhags pas bcings nas zhags pa thams cad drangs te lag tu thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsams pa dang / don du gnyer ba dang / yid la re ba'i dgos pa de thams cad shin tu ring po nas kyang don yod pa'i zhags pas bcings nas zhags pa thams cad drangs te lag tu thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: All those needs that are wished for, sought after, and hoped for, even from far away, will be bound by Amogha-pāśa. All those who are bound will be drawn forth and placed in the hand.

original: sgrub pa mchog gi dngos grub kyi de kho na nyid thams cad 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgrub pa mchog gi dngos grub kyi de kho na nyid thams cad 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: One will accomplish all the suchnesses of the supreme accomplishment.

original: mi snang bar gyur /
analyzed: mi snang bar gyur /
translated: One will become invisible.

original: rig sngags 'chang ba nam mkha' la mchi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang ba nam mkha' la mchi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will fly through space.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gang du sangs rgyas kyi zhing khams gang dang gang du mchi 'tshal ba de dang de thams cad du mchi bar @225a *//
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gang du sangs rgyas kyi zhing khams gang dang gang du mchi 'tshal ba de dang de thams cad du mchi bar @225a *//
translated: One will go to any buddhafield in any world system that one wishes to go to.

original: 'gyur te / thams cad du gtso bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur te / thams cad du gtso bor 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be foremost in all of them.

original: thams cad du mchod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad du mchod par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be worshipped in all of them.

original: ci ste rmi lam mthong bar 'tshal na gu gul la lan brgya rtsa brgyad yongs su bzlas nas /
analyzed: ci ste rmi lam mthong bar 'tshal na gu gul la lan brgya rtsa brgyad yongs su bzlas nas /
translated: “If one wants to have a vision in a dream, one should incant guggula one hundred and eight times,

original: nyal kar 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la bdug spos su phul te nyal na /
analyzed: nyal kar 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la bdug spos su phul te nyal na /
translated: and offer it as incense to noble Avalokiteśvara before going to sleep.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rgyal po'i cha byad du mthong ba stsol cing /
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rgyal po'i cha byad du mthong ba stsol cing /
translated: Noble Avalokiteśvara will grant a vision of himself in the form of a king.

original: gang bsam pa dang / gang dris pa de thams cad smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang bsam pa dang / gang dris pa de thams cad smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will tell one everything that one thinks of and everything that one asks him.”

original: ji ltar bsam pa'i mchog stsol cing sgrib pa dang sdig pa thams cad ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar bsam pa'i mchog stsol cing sgrib pa dang sdig pa thams cad ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever is thought of will be granted, and all obscurations and misdeeds will be eliminated.

original: stobs dang / brtson 'grus dang / mdangs 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stobs dang / brtson 'grus dang / mdangs 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Strength, diligence, and radiance will be infused.

original: tshangs pa dgug par 'tshal zhing mthong bar 'tshal na /
analyzed: tshangs pa dgug par 'tshal zhing mthong bar 'tshal na /
translated: If one wishes to summon and see Brahmā,

original: de'i tshe shing aarga'i 'o ma dang / gu gul dang / rgya skyegs ril bur bgyis pa la bzlas brjod brgya rtsa brgyad bgyis la /
analyzed: de'i tshe shing aarga'i 'o ma dang / gu gul dang / rgya skyegs ril bur bgyis pa la bzlas brjod brgya rtsa brgyad bgyis la /
translated: at that time one should incant a pill made of arka milk, guggul, and lac one hundred and eight times.

original: tshangs pa la bdug spos su phul na /
analyzed: tshangs pa la bdug spos su phul na /
translated: Offer it as incense to Brahmā.

original: tshangs pa rang gi gzugs kyis mdun na mchis shing mchog 'tshal ba thams cad rjes su stsol to //
analyzed: tshangs pa rang gi gzugs kyis mdun na mchis shing mchog 'tshal ba thams cad rjes su stsol to //
translated: Brahmā will appear in his own form in front of one and grant whatever is requested.

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten la thug pa'i bar gyi tshangs pa'i gnas dang gzhal med khang mthong bar 'gyur zhing tshangs ba'i gzugs kyi cha byad 'chang ba'i mchog stsol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten la thug pa'i bar gyi tshangs pa'i gnas dang gzhal med khang mthong bar 'gyur zhing tshangs ba'i gzugs kyi cha byad 'chang ba'i mchog stsol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will see the Brahmā abodes and palaces up to the Brahmā world, and he will grant the supreme form of Brahmā.

original: lha'i gnas thams cad du mes bo yin no zhes tshig mngon par brjod bar  @225b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha'i gnas thams cad du mes bo yin no zhes tshig mngon par brjod bar  @225b 'gyur ro //
translated: In all the divine abodes, the words “He is my uncle” will be uttered.

original: 'jig rten thams cad dang / 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i mi bud med dang / skyes ba dang / khye'u dang / bu mo dang / dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs de thams cad thams cad du tshangs pa'o zhes sems par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad dang / 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i mi bud med dang / skyes ba dang / khye'u dang / bu mo dang / dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs de thams cad thams cad du tshangs pa'o zhes sems par 'gyur ro //
translated: All the people of the world, the women, men, boys, girls, ascetics, brahmins, kṣatriyas, vaiśyas, and śūdras of Jambūdvīpa will think, “All of them are Brahmā.”

original: rgyal po btsun mo dang / 'khor du bcas pas mchod pa'i sprin chen po bgyid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal po btsun mo dang / 'khor du bcas pas mchod pa'i sprin chen po bgyid par 'gyur ro //
translated: The king, together with his queens and retinue, will make great clouds of offerings.

original: de nas sred med kyi bu dgug par 'tshal na /
analyzed: de nas sred med kyi bu dgug par 'tshal na /
translated: Then, if one wishes to summon Nārāyaṇa,

original: des lha'i gnas su sred med kyi bu'i gzugs brnyan gyi mdun du nye bar sbyin sreg gi cho ga bgyi ste /
analyzed: des lha'i gnas su sred med kyi bu'i gzugs brnyan gyi mdun du nye bar sbyin sreg gi cho ga bgyi ste /
translated: one should perform the homa rite in front of a mirror image of Nārāyaṇa in a divine abode.

original: rig sngags 'chang gtsang mar gyur pa /🔽shin tu khrus bgyis pa /
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang gtsang mar gyur pa / shin tu khrus bgyis pa /
translated: The knowledge-mantra practitioner should be pure,🔽thoroughly washed,

original: gos gtsang ma bgos pa /
analyzed: gos gtsang ma bgos pa /
translated: and wearing clean clothes.

original: sna ma dang shing aarga'i ya ma sreg shing gi me sbar ba la gu gul dang / yungs kar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / zhun mar bsres pa'i sbyin sreg brgya stong bgyi'o //
analyzed: sna ma dang shing aarga'i ya ma sreg shing gi me sbar ba la gu gul dang / yungs kar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / zhun mar bsres pa'i sbyin sreg brgya stong bgyi'o //
translated: He should make a fire of agalloch, white mustard seeds, honey, and clarified butter in a fire of jasmine and arka wood.

original: brgya stong rdzogs pa dang / sred med kyi bu rang gi gzugs kyis mdun na mchis shing rig sngags 'chang /
analyzed: brgya stong rdzogs pa dang / sred med kyi bu rang gi gzugs kyis mdun na mchis shing rig sngags 'chang /
translated: When he has completed a hundred thousand offerings, Nārāyaṇa will appear in his own form before the reciter of the spell.

original: legs so legs so //
analyzed: legs so legs so //
translated: He will say, “Excellent, excellent!

original: zhes smra'o // sgrub pa dam pa 'di don yod pa'i lcags kyus 'gugs shing rig sngags kyi rgyal po'i chos lugs chen pos bkug na /
analyzed: zhes smra'o // sgrub pa dam pa 'di don yod pa'i lcags kyus 'gugs shing rig sngags kyi rgyal po'i chos lugs chen pos bkug na /
translated: If you have summoned him with the invincible hook and brought him with the great Dharma of the king of spells,

original: rig sngags 'chang ci zhig kyang /🔽dgos pa ni /
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang ci zhig kyang / dgos pa ni /
translated: what is it that the reciter of the spell🔽needs?

original: ci zhig yod /
analyzed: ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the purpose?

original: mchog ni / ci zhig don du gnyer ba de smros shig dang / thams cad rjes su sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: mchog ni / ci zhig don du gnyer ba de smros shig dang / thams cad rjes su sbyin par bya'o //
translated: What is the supreme goal that you seek? Tell me, and I will give you everything.”

original: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis don @226a *//
analyzed: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis don @226a *//
translated: Then the reciter of the spell

original: gang yid la bsams te smras pa de thams cad stsol bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang yid la bsams te smras pa de thams cad stsol bar 'gyur /
translated: will tell him whatever it is that he has in mind. He will give him everything.

original: gzugs sna tshogs pa'i mchog kyang rjes su stsol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs sna tshogs pa'i mchog kyang rjes su stsol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will also grant the supreme of various forms.

original: gzhan yang gzugs sna tshogs pa mchog gtso bo dang / dgos pa'i las sgrub pa'i mchog rjes su stsol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang gzugs sna tshogs pa mchog gtso bo dang / dgos pa'i las sgrub pa'i mchog rjes su stsol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, he will grant the supreme of various forms, the chief, and the supreme of accomplishing the activities of the necessary tasks.

original: de nas lha chen po dgug par 'tshal na /
analyzed: de nas lha chen po dgug par 'tshal na /
translated: Then, if one wishes to summon the great gods,

original: rig sngags 'chang gtsang ma shin tu khrus bgyis pa gos gtsang ma bgos pa des lha'i gnas su mchis pa la lha chen po'i mdun du gu gul dang / padma'i phye ma dang zhun mar bsres pa'i sbyin sreg stong rtsa brgyad bgyi'o //
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang gtsang ma shin tu khrus bgyis pa gos gtsang ma bgos pa des lha'i gnas su mchis pa la lha chen po'i mdun du gu gul dang / padma'i phye ma dang zhun mar bsres pa'i sbyin sreg stong rtsa brgyad bgyi'o //
translated: the pure vidyādhara, having bathed well and put on clean clothes, should go to the abode of the gods. In front of the great god, he should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of gugul, lotus flower powder, and clarified butter.

original: stong rtsa brgyad rdzogs pa dang / lha chen po rang gi gzugs kyis mdun na mchis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong rtsa brgyad rdzogs pa dang / lha chen po rang gi gzugs kyis mdun na mchis par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the one thousand and eight are completed, the great god will appear in his own form in front of him.

original: de nas nag po chen po dgug par 'tshal na /
analyzed: de nas nag po chen po dgug par 'tshal na /
translated: Then, if one wishes to summon Mahākāla,

original: rig sngags 'chang shin tu khrus bgyis pa gos gtsang ma bgos pas dur khrod du mchis la /
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang shin tu khrus bgyis pa gos gtsang ma bgos pas dur khrod du mchis la /
translated: the vidyādhara, having bathed well and put on clean clothes, should go to a charnel ground.

original: zla ba mar gyi ngo'i ches bcu bzhi la nyin zhag gcig smyung ba bgyis pas padma gsar pa'i phye ma dang / gu gul dang / ra'i khrag dang / yungs kar dang / zhun mar dang sbyar ba brgyad stong don yod pa'i lcags kyu'i bzlas brjod kyis dur khrod kyi shing gi me la bzlas brjod bgyi'o //
analyzed: zla ba mar gyi ngo'i ches bcu bzhi la nyin zhag gcig smyung ba bgyis pas padma gsar pa'i phye ma dang / gu gul dang / ra'i khrag dang / yungs kar dang / zhun mar dang sbyar ba brgyad stong don yod pa'i lcags kyu'i bzlas brjod kyis dur khrod kyi shing gi me la bzlas brjod bgyi'o //
translated: On the fourteenth day of the waning moon, having fasted for one day and night, one should recite the mantra of Amoghapasha eight thousand times over a mixture of fresh lotus pollen, guggul, blood of a goat, white mustard seed, and clarified butter, and offer it into a fire of charnel ground wood.
